article:
2023 FIFA Women's World Cup squads

The 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup is the ninth edition of the FIFA Women's World Cup, the quadrennial international soccer championship contested by the women's national teams of the member associations of FIFA. article:
Tennis Pro Tours and Tournament Ranking Series

Tennis has a long and storied history, with professional tours and tournament ranking series playing a crucial role in shaping the sport into what it is today. The various tours and series provide a structure for players to compete against each other, earn prize money, and gain recognition. This article provides an overview of the world championship tours, tournament ranking series, and other professional tours in tennis.

# World Championship Tours

The world championship tours in tennis are a series of tournaments that bring together the best players from around the globe to compete for the highest honors. These tours are the pinnacle of professional tennis, offering the largest prize purses and the most coveted titles.

## Winners

The winners of the world championship tours are considered the best of the best, having demonstrated exceptional skill, strategy, and mental toughness. Some notable winners include:

* The Four Majors: The Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open are the four most prestigious tournaments in tennis, with winners receiving the highest accolades and prize money.
* ATP Finals: The ATP Finals, formerly known as the Masters Cup, is a tournament that brings together the top eight players in the world to compete for the season-ending championship.
* WTA Finals: The WTA Finals, formerly known as the WTA Tour Championships, is a tournament that brings together the top eight players in the world to compete for the season-ending championship.

# Tournament Ranking Series

The tournament ranking series is a system used to rank players based on their performance in various tournaments throughout the year. The series provides a framework for players to earn points and improve their ranking, with the ultimate goal of becoming the world's top-ranked player.

## Winners

The winners of the tournament ranking series are determined by the player who accumulates the most points throughout the year. Some notable winners include:

* ATP Rankings: The ATP Rankings are the official rankings of the Association of Tennis Professionals, with the top-ranked player being considered the best in the world.
* WTA Rankings: The WTA Rankings are the official rankings of the Women's Tennis Association, with the top-ranked player being considered the best in the world.
* Grand Slam Champions: The winners of the four Grand Slam tournaments are considered among the best in the world, with each tournament offering a significant amount of ranking points.

# Other Professional Tours

In addition to the world championship tours and tournament ranking series, there are several other professional tours that provide opportunities for players to compete and earn prize money.

## Women

The women's professional tennis tour is overseen by the Women's Tennis Association (WTA), which governs and promotes women's tennis worldwide. The WTA Tour is a series of tournaments that take place throughout the year, offering prize money and ranking points to participants.

## Men

The men's professional tennis tour is overseen by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP), which governs and promotes men's tennis worldwide. The ATP Tour is a series of tournaments that take place throughout the year, offering prize money and ranking points to participants.

# See also

* Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP)
* Women's Tennis Association (WTA)
* International Tennis Federation (ITF)
* Grand Slam (tennis)
* ATP Finals
* WTA Finals

# Notes

The world of professional tennis is complex and multifaceted, with various tours and series providing opportunities for players to compete and earn recognition. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the world championship tours, tournament ranking series, and other professional tours in tennis.

# References

* Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP). (n.d.). ATP Tour. Retrieved from <https://www.atptour.com/>
* Women's Tennis Association (WTA). (n.d.). WTA Tour. Retrieved from <https://www.wtatennis.com/>
* International Tennis Federation (ITF). (n.d.). ITF Pro Circuit. Retrieved from <https://www.itftennis.com/>

# Bibliography

* Collins, B. (2019). The Bud Collins Tennis Encyclopedia. Detroit, MI: Visible Ink Press.
* Evans, R. (2018). Tennis: A Very Short Introduction. Oxford, UK: Oxford University Press.
* Grasso, J. (2011). Historical Dictionary of Tennis. Lanham, MD: Scarecrow Press.

# External links

* Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP). (n.d.). ATP Tour. Retrieved from <https://www.atptour.com/>
* Women's Tennis Association (WTA). (n.d.). WTA Tour. Retrieved from <https://www.wtatennis.com/>
* International Tennis Federation (ITF). (n.d.). ITF Pro Circuit. Retrieved from <https://www.itftennis.com/>

article:
2023 UK Open

The 2023 UK Open is a professional darts tournament that took place from March 3-5, 2023, at the Butlin's Resort in Minehead, England. The event is one of the most prestigious tournaments on the Professional Darts Corporation (PDC) calendar and features a unique format that allows players from various levels of the game to compete against each other.

#Prize money

The total prize fund for the 2023 UK Open was £500,000, with the winner receiving £100,000 and the runner-up £40,000. The prize money was distributed as follows:

* Winner: £100,000
* Runner-up: £40,000
* Semi-finalists: £20,000
* Quarter-finalists: £15,000
* Fifth-round losers: £10,000
* Sixth-round losers: £7,500
* Fourth-round losers: £5,000
* Third-round losers: £3,000
* Second-round losers: £2,000
* First-round losers: £1,000

#Format

The 2023 UK Open featured a unique format that allowed players from various levels of the game to compete against each other. The tournament began with a series of rounds, with players entering the competition at different stages based on their ranking on the PDC Order of Merit. The format was as follows:

* First round: Players ranked 97-128 on the PDC Order of Merit, PDC Development Tour qualifiers, PDC Challenge Tour qualifiers, and amateur qualifiers competed in a best-of-eleven legs match.
* Second round: Players ranked 65-96 on the PDC Order of Merit joined the winners from the first round, competing in a best-of-eleven legs match.
* Third round: Players ranked 33-64 on the PDC Order of Merit joined the winners from the second round, competing in a best-of-eleven legs match.
* Fourth round: Players ranked 1-32 on the PDC Order of Merit joined the winners from the third round, competing in a best-of-nineteen legs match.
* Fifth and sixth rounds: The winners from the fourth round competed in a best-of-nineteen legs match.
* Quarter-finals, semi-finals, and final: The winners from the sixth round competed in a best-of-nineteen legs match, with the final being played as a best-of-twenty-one legs match.

article:
2023 Scottish National Party leadership election

The 2023 Scottish National Party leadership election was a leadership election held to determine the next leader of the Scottish National Party (SNP), who would also become the First Minister of Scotland. The election was triggered by the resignation of Nicola Sturgeon as leader of the SNP on February 15, 2023. The contest was contested by three candidates: Kate Forbes, Ash Regan, and Humza Yousaf.

# Background

Nicola Sturgeon had been the leader of the SNP since November 2014 and the First Minister of Scotland since the same month. During her tenure, she had led the party through two Scottish Parliament elections and the 2019 UK general election, as well as navigating the complexities of the COVID-19 pandemic. However, in February 2023, Sturgeon announced her resignation as leader of the SNP, citing a desire to spend more time with her family and to allow a new leader to take the party forward.

The SNP's national executive committee (NEC) subsequently announced the rules for the leadership contest, which included a requirement for candidates to secure the support of at least 100 party members to be nominated. The contest was also subject to a one-member-one-vote system, with all SNP members eligible to vote.

# Issues

The leadership contest took place against the backdrop of several key issues that were relevant to the SNP and the Scottish Government.

## Economics

One of the key issues in the contest was the state of the Scottish economy. The SNP had long advocated for Scottish independence, which would give the country control over its own economic policy. However, the party had also faced criticism for its handling of the economy, including the performance of key sectors such as oil and gas.

## Independence

The issue of Scottish independence was also a central theme in the leadership contest. The SNP had long campaigned for independence, and the party's constitution commits it to achieving this goal. However, the party had faced setbacks in recent years, including the 2014 independence referendum and the UK Supreme Court's ruling that the Scottish Parliament did not have the power to hold a second referendum without the consent of the UK Parliament.

## Gender recognition reform

Another issue that was relevant to the leadership contest was the Scottish Government's proposed reforms to the Gender Recognition Act. The reforms, which had been a key priority for Nicola Sturgeon, aimed to make it easier for transgender people to change their legal gender. However, the proposals had faced opposition from some within the party, who argued that they did not go far enough to protect the rights of women.

# Campaign

The leadership contest was marked by a series of campaigns by the three candidates, each of whom sought to set out their vision for the SNP and the Scottish Government.

## Nomination period

The nomination period for the contest opened on February 20, 2023, and closed on March 1, 2023. During this time, candidates were required to secure the support of at least 100 party members to be nominated.

## Kate Forbes

Kate Forbes, the Finance Secretary, was the first candidate to launch her campaign. Forbes had been a key figure in the Scottish Government, and had played a leading role in the development of the party's economic policy. Her campaign focused on the need for the SNP to develop a more nuanced approach to the economy, and to prioritize the needs of business and industry.

## Ash Regan

Ash Regan, a former minister, launched her campaign on February 22, 2023. Regan had been a key figure in the SNP's left wing, and had been a vocal critic of the party's leadership in recent years. Her campaign focused on the need for the SNP to return to its radical roots, and to prioritize the needs of the most vulnerable members of society.

## Humza Yousaf

Humza Yousaf, the Health Secretary, launched his campaign on February 24, 2023. Yousaf had been a key figure in the Scottish Government, and had played a leading role in the development of the party's health policy. His campaign focused on the need for the SNP to prioritize the needs of the NHS, and to develop a more comprehensive approach to public health.

## Hustings

The three candidates took part in a series of hustings events, which were organized by the SNP's NEC. The events gave party members the opportunity to question the candidates and to hear their views on key issues.

## Row about membership numbers

During the campaign, a row broke out about the number of SNP members who were eligible to vote in the contest. The party's NEC had announced that the contest would be confined to members who had joined the party before February 2023. However, some candidates argued that this was unfair, and that it would disenfranchise thousands of members who had joined the party in recent weeks.

# Election process

The election process for the leadership contest was overseen by the SNP's NEC. The contest was subject to a one-member-one-vote system, with all SNP members eligible to vote. The NEC also established a series of rules for the contest, including a requirement for candidates to secure the support of at least 100 party members to be nominated.

# Candidates

Three candidates stood in the leadership contest.

## Declared

* Kate Forbes
* Ash Regan
* Humza Yousaf

## Declined

Several other senior SNP figures declined to stand in the contest, including the party's Westminster leader, Ian Blackford, and the Deputy First Minister, John Swinney.

# Endorsements

The three candidates received endorsements from various SNP figures and organizations.

## Kate Forbes

Forbes was endorsed by several senior SNP figures, including the party's former leader, Alex Salmond, and the former First Minister, Jack McConnell.

## Ash Regan

Regan was endorsed by several left-wing SNP figures, including the party's former deputy leader, Angus Robertson, and the former minister, Mark McDonald.

## Humza Yousaf

Yousaf was endorsed by several senior SNP figures, including the party's former leader, Nicola Sturgeon, and the Deputy First Minister, John Swinney.

## Declined to endorse

Several senior SNP figures declined to endorse any of the candidates, including the party's Westminster leader, Ian Blackford, and the former First Minister, Henry McLeish.

# Debates

The three candidates took part in a series of debates, which were broadcast on television and radio. The debates gave the candidates the opportunity to set out their views on key issues and to respond to questions from journalists and party members.

# Hustings

The three candidates also took part in a series of hustings events, which were organized by the SNP's NEC. The events gave party members the opportunity to question the candidates and to hear their views on key issues.

# Opinion polling

Several opinion polls were conducted during the leadership contest, which gave an indication of the level of support for each of the candidates.

## SNP membership

A poll of SNP members found that Humza Yousaf was the most popular candidate, with 42% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 32%, and Ash Regan was third, with 26%.

## 2021 SNP voters

A poll of SNP voters from the 2021 Scottish Parliament election found that Humza Yousaf was the most popular candidate, with 45% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 29%, and Ash Regan was third, with 26%.

## Scottish public

A poll of the Scottish public found that Humza Yousaf was the most popular candidate, with 34% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 24%, and Ash Regan was third, with 22%.

# Results

The results of the leadership contest were announced on March 27, 2023. Humza Yousaf was declared the winner, with 52.1% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 31.7%, and Ash Regan was third, with 16.2%.

## Preference votes by candidate

* Humza Yousaf: 52.1%
* Kate Forbes: 31.7%
* Ash Regan: 16.2%

# Aftermath

Following the announcement of the results, Humza Yousaf was formally appointed as the leader of the SNP and the First Minister of Scotland. He pledged to work tirelessly to promote the interests of Scotland and to deliver on the party's manifesto commitments.

The leadership contest was seen as a significant moment in the history of the SNP, marking a new era for the party and a fresh direction for the Scottish Government.

article:
Grant Wahl
================

Grant Wahl was an American sports journalist, best known for his work as a soccer writer for Sports Illustrated. He was a prominent voice in the world of soccer, covering numerous high-profile events, including the FIFA World Cup and the Olympics. Wahl's writing style was characterized by his in-depth analysis, engaging storytelling, and commitment to shedding light on social and cultural issues surrounding the sport.

Early Life and Education
------------------------

Grant Wahl was born on December 29, 1974, in Mission, Kansas. He grew up in a family of modest means, with his parents instilling in him a love for sports from an early age. Wahl's interest in soccer was sparked by watching the 1986 World Cup, and he soon became a passionate fan of the sport. He attended Shawnee Mission East High School, where he played soccer and developed a strong work ethic that would serve him well in his future career.

Wahl went on to study at Princeton University, where he earned a Bachelor's degree in Politics in 1996. During his time at Princeton, he began to develop his writing skills, serving as the sports editor of the university's student newspaper, The Daily Princetonian.

Career
--------

After graduating from Princeton, Wahl landed an internship at the Miami Herald, where he covered local sports events. He soon moved to the Kansas City Star, where he wrote about the Kansas City Wizards, the city's professional soccer team. In 1996, Wahl joined Sports Illustrated as a fact-checker, eventually working his way up to become a full-time writer.

Wahl's big break came in 2002, when he was assigned to cover the World Cup in South Korea and Japan. His in-depth analysis and engaging storytelling quickly established him as one of the leading voices in American soccer journalism. Over the years, Wahl covered numerous high-profile events, including the Olympics, the European Championship, and the Copa America.

Wahl was also known for his investigative reporting, often shedding light on social and cultural issues surrounding the sport. In 2015, he wrote a series of exposés on corruption within FIFA, which contributed to the eventual downfall of the organization's leadership. His reporting earned him numerous awards and recognition, including the National Sports Journalism Association's Investigative Story of the Year award.

Personal Life
-------------

Wahl was married to Celine Gounder, a medical journalist and infectious disease specialist. The couple met while covering the 2010 World Cup in South Africa and were married in 2017. Wahl was known for his dry sense of humor and his love of Twitter, where he often engaged with fans and fellow journalists.

Death
------

Grant Wahl died on December 9, 2022, while covering the World Cup in Lusail, Qatar. He was 48 years old. The cause of death was determined to be a pulmonary embolism, a blockage of an artery in the lungs.

Awards and Recognition
----------------------

Wahl received numerous awards and recognition for his work, including:

* National Sports Journalism Association's Investigative Story of the Year award (2015)
* Sports Illustrated's Sports Journalism Award (2016)
* Football Writers' Association of America's Best Feature Writing award (2017)

Books
------

Wahl wrote one book, "The Beckham Experiment," which was published in 2009. The book chronicled David Beckham's move to Major League Soccer and the impact it had on the sport in the United States.

See Also
--------

* Sports Illustrated
* FIFA World Cup
* Major League Soccer
* David Beckham

----------

article:
Silly Mountain

Silly Mountain is a prominent geological feature located in the heart of the Whimsy Range, a mountainous region known for its unique landscape and diverse ecosystems. The mountain has been a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers for centuries, offering a wide range of recreational activities and breathtaking views. This article provides an overview of Silly Mountain's location, origin of its name, flora, fauna, geology, and recreational opportunities.

#Location

Silly Mountain is situated in the Whimsy Range, a mountainous region that stretches across several counties in the western part of the country. The mountain is approximately 10 miles (16 kilometers) east of the town of Sillimania and 20 miles (32 kilometers) west of the city of Whimsyville. The mountain's summit elevation is 4,200 feet (1,280 meters) above sea level, making it one of the highest peaks in the Whimsy Range.

#Origin of the name

The origin of the name "Silly Mountain" is unclear, but there are several theories. One theory suggests that the name "Silly" comes from the mountain's unusual shape, which resembles a giant's hat. Another theory proposes that the name "Silly" is derived from the word "sill," a geological term that refers to a layer of rock that forms a narrow, horizontal band. Yet another theory suggests that the name "Silly" is simply a colloquialism that was adopted by local residents to describe the mountain's whimsical nature.

#Flora

Silly Mountain is home to a diverse range of flora, including trees, shrubs, and wildflowers. The mountain's forests are dominated by coniferous species such as pine, spruce, and fir, which thrive in the cool, moist climate. Deciduous species such as oak, maple, and beech are also present, particularly in the mountain's lower elevations. The mountain's meadows are filled with a variety of wildflowers, including lupine, columbine, and gentian.

##Fauna

Silly Mountain is home to a wide range of fauna, including mammals, birds, and insects.

###Birds

The mountain is a popular destination for birdwatchers, with over 100 species of birds documented in the area. Common species include the American robin, the red-winged blackbird, and the common raven. The mountain is also a key habitat for several species of raptors, including the bald eagle, the osprey, and the peregrine falcon.

#Geology

Silly Mountain is a geological anomaly, with a unique combination of rock formations and landforms. The mountain's core is composed of granite, a hard, dense rock that formed millions of years ago. The granite is surrounded by layers of sedimentary rock, including sandstone, shale, and conglomerate. The mountain's surface is dotted with numerous boulders and rock outcroppings, which provide a glimpse into the mountain's geological history.

##Mining

Silly Mountain has a long history of mining, with several mineral deposits documented in the area. The mountain's granite core is rich in minerals such as quartz, feldspar, and mica, which have been mined for centuries. The mountain's sedimentary rocks are also rich in minerals such as copper, lead, and zinc, which have been extracted through a variety of mining techniques.

#Recreation

Silly Mountain offers a wide range of recreational opportunities, including mountain biking, hiking, and botanical walks.

##Mountain biking

The mountain has over 20 miles (32 kilometers) of mountain biking trails, ranging from easy to difficult. The trails offer stunning views of the surrounding countryside and provide a challenging workout for riders of all skill levels.

##Hiking

The mountain has numerous hiking trails, including the popular Silly Mountain Trail, which takes hikers to the mountain's summit. The trail offers breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside and provides a glimpse into the mountain's unique geology and ecosystems.

##Botanical walk

The mountain's botanical walk is a self-guided tour that takes visitors through the mountain's diverse ecosystems. The walk features numerous plant species, including trees, shrubs, and wildflowers, and provides a glimpse into the mountain's unique flora.

#Silly Mountain Park

Silly Mountain Park is a 500-acre (202-hectare) park that surrounds the mountain. The park offers a wide range of recreational opportunities, including camping, picnicking, and wildlife watching. The park is also home to several historic sites, including the old Silly Mountain Mine and the Silly Mountain Lookout Tower.

The Royal Rumble is a professional wrestling event produced by WWE. It took place on January 28, 2023, at the Alamodome in San Antonio, Texas. This event marked the 36th edition of the Royal Rumble, a pay-per-view (PPV) staple in the WWE calendar.

# Production

## Background

The Royal Rumble is an annual professional wrestling event that features a unique match format, where a large number of wrestlers compete in a battle royal-style match, with the winner earning a world championship match at WrestleMania. The event typically features a combination of established stars, up-and-coming talent, and surprise returns. This year's event was held at the Alamodome, a large indoor stadium with a seating capacity of over 65,000.

## Storylines

The road to the Royal Rumble began several weeks prior to the event, with various storylines and feuds unfolding on WWE's weekly television shows, Monday Night Raw and Friday Night SmackDown. One of the main storylines centered around the Universal Championship, held by Roman Reigns, who was seeking to defend his title against a number of challengers. Another major storyline involved the Raw Women's Championship, held by Bianca Belair, who was facing a challenge from Alexa Bliss.

# Event

The Royal Rumble event kicked off with a pre-show, featuring a match between the Viking Raiders and the Street Profits. The main card began with the first match, pitting the Raw Women's Champion Bianca Belair against Alexa Bliss.

## Preliminary matches

The first match saw Bianca Belair successfully defend her Raw Women's Championship against Alexa Bliss. The match was a back-and-forth contest, with both women trading near-falls and showcasing their athleticism.

The next match featured Bray Wyatt taking on LA Knight in a Mountain Dew Pitch Black match. The match was a unique and intense contest, with both men using a variety of moves and objects to gain an advantage.

## Main event

The main event of the evening was the Men's Royal Rumble match, featuring 30 male wrestlers competing for a chance to earn a world championship match at WrestleMania. The match began with the first two entrants, Sheamus and the Miz, who were followed by a steady stream of wrestlers, including Cody Rhodes, Seth Rollins, and Drew McIntyre.

The match was filled with surprises and eliminations, as wrestlers were tossed over the ropes and out of the ring. In the end, it was Cody Rhodes who emerged victorious, last eliminating Gunther to earn his spot in the main event of WrestleMania.

The Women's Royal Rumble match took place later in the evening, featuring 30 female wrestlers competing for a chance to earn a women's championship match at WrestleMania. The match was a thrilling contest, with a number of surprises and eliminations.

In the end, it was Rhea Ripley who emerged victorious, last eliminating Liv Morgan to earn her spot in the main event of WrestleMania.

# Reception

The Royal Rumble event received positive reviews from fans and critics alike, with many praising the unique match format and the surprises that unfolded throughout the evening.

# Aftermath

## Raw

The night after the Royal Rumble, Monday Night Raw saw a number of fallout matches and storylines unfold. Cody Rhodes, the winner of the Men's Royal Rumble match, was interviewed by Kevin Patrick, where he discussed his plans for WrestleMania.

## SmackDown

Friday Night SmackDown saw Rhea Ripley, the winner of the Women's Royal Rumble match, confront the SmackDown Women's Champion, Charlotte Flair. The two women exchanged words and blows, setting up a potential match for WrestleMania.

2023 Malaysia Super League

The 2023 Malaysia Super League is the 20th season of the Malaysia Super League, the top-tier professional football league in Malaysia. The season began on 24 February 2023 and is scheduled to conclude on 27 August 2023.

# Teams

The 2023 Malaysia Super League features 14 teams, with two teams promoted from the 2022 Malaysia Premier League and two teams relegated from the 2022 Malaysia Super League.

## Changes from last season

### Team changes

* Kuala Lumpur City and Kuching City were promoted from the 2022 Malaysia Premier League.
* Melaka United and Sarawak United were relegated to the 2023 Malaysia Premier League.

## Clubs locations

Here are the locations of the 14 teams participating in the 2023 Malaysia Super League:

* East Coast: Terengganu, Kelantan United, Kelantan
* Central Region: Selangor, Petaling Jaya City, Kuala Lumpur City
* Southern Region: Johor Darul Ta'zim, Johor Darul Ta'zim II
* East Malaysia: Sabah, Kuching City, Sarawak

# Personnel, kit and sponsoring

Here is a list of the personnel, kit and sponsoring of the 14 teams participating in the 2023 Malaysia Super League:

## Coaching changes

* Johor Darul Ta'zim: Héctor Bidoglio (replaced Benjamin Mora)
* Kuala Lumpur City: Bojan Hodak (replaced Radhi Mat Din)

# Foreign players

Each team is allowed to register a maximum of five foreign players, with a minimum of two players from the Asian Football Confederation (AFC).

## Naturalisation/Heritage players

Players who have acquired Malaysian citizenship or have Malaysian heritage are not considered foreign players.

article:
Super Bowl LVI

Super Bowl LVI was the 56th Super Bowl and the culmination of the 2021 National Football League (NFL) season. The game was played on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, marking the first time a Super Bowl was held at the stadium.

# Background

## Host selection process

The host selection process for Super Bowl LVI began in 2016, when the NFL announced a new bidding process for the game. SoFi Stadium was selected as the host site in May 2019, after a unanimous vote by the NFL owners. The stadium, which is the home of the Los Angeles Rams and the Los Angeles Chargers, opened in 2020 and features a unique design with a translucent roof and a large video board.

## Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the planning and execution of Super Bowl LVI. The NFL implemented various health and safety protocols, including mandatory vaccination for all players, coaches, and staff, as well as reduced capacity at the stadium. The league also worked closely with local health authorities to ensure compliance with all relevant guidelines and regulations.

# Teams

## Los Angeles Rams

The Los Angeles Rams, representing the NFC, entered the game as the fourth seed in the conference. They finished the regular season with a 12-5 record, winning the NFC West division title. The Rams were led by quarterback Matthew Stafford, who threw for 4,886 yards and 41 touchdowns during the regular season.

## Cincinnati Bengals

The Cincinnati Bengals, representing the AFC, entered the game as the fourth seed in the conference. They finished the regular season with a 10-7 record, winning the AFC North division title. The Bengals were led by quarterback Joe Burrow, who threw for 4,611 yards and 30 touchdowns during the regular season.

## Playoffs

Both teams had to navigate the playoffs to reach the Super Bowl. The Rams defeated the Arizona Cardinals in the Wild Card Round, followed by victories over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the San Francisco 49ers in the Divisional Round and the NFC Championship Game, respectively. The Bengals defeated the Las Vegas Raiders in the Wild Card Round, followed by victories over the Tennessee Titans and the Kansas City Chiefs in the Divisional Round and the AFC Championship Game, respectively.

## Pre-game notes

The Rams were considered the favorites to win the game, with a 4.5-point spread in their favor. However, the Bengals were confident in their chances, with Burrow stating that his team was "ready to go out there and take it." The game was also notable for being the first Super Bowl matchup between two teams with quarterbacks who were first overall picks in the NFL draft.

# Entertainment

## Pre-game ceremonies

The pre-game ceremonies featured a performance by Mickey Guyton, who sang the national anthem. The coin toss was performed by Billie Jean King, who was joined by former NFL players and civil rights activists Jim Brown and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

## Halftime show

The halftime show featured a performance by Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige, and Kendrick Lamar. The show was widely praised for its high-energy performance and nostalgic value, with many fans praising the inclusion of classic hip-hop hits.

# Broadcasting

## United States

### Television

The game was broadcast on NBC, with Al Michaels and Cris Collinsworth serving as the play-by-play announcers. The broadcast also featured reports from sideline reporters Michele Tafoya and Kathryn Tappen.

#### Advertising

The game featured a number of high-profile advertisements, including spots from major brands such as Apple, Amazon, and Pepsi. The ads were widely praised for their creativity and humor, with many fans taking to social media to share their favorite spots.

### Streaming

The game was also available to stream on various platforms, including the NBC Sports app and Peacock. The stream was widely praised for its high quality and reliability, with many fans opting to watch the game on their mobile devices or smart TVs.

### Radio

The game was broadcast on Westwood One radio, with Kevin Harlan and Tony Boselli serving as the play-by-play announcers.

### Ratings and viewership

The game was watched by an estimated 112.3 million viewers, making it one of the most-watched television events of the year. The game also received a 36.9 household rating, with a 68 share.

## International

The game was broadcast in over 180 countries and territories, with a number of international broadcasters carrying the game. The game was also available to stream on various international platforms, including the NFL's own streaming service.

# Game summary

## First half

The game got off to a slow start, with both teams struggling to move the ball. However, the Rams were able to break through with a 79-yard touchdown pass from Stafford to Cooper Kupp. The Bengals responded with a field goal, but the Rams were able to extend their lead with a 1-yard touchdown run by Cam Akers.

## Second half

The Bengals were able to get back in the game with a 75-yard touchdown pass from Burrow to Tee Higgins. However, the Rams were able to respond with a 79-yard touchdown pass from Stafford to Kupp. The Bengals were able to score another touchdown, but the Rams were able to seal the win with a late field goal.

## Box score

Los Angeles Rams

* Matthew Stafford: 26/40, 283 yards, 3 TDs, 2 INTs
* Cam Akers: 21 carries, 92 yards, 1 TD
* Cooper Kupp: 8 receptions, 92 yards, 2 TDs

Cincinnati Bengals

* Joe Burrow: 22/33, 263 yards, 1 TD, 0 INTs
* Joe Mixon: 15 carries, 72 yards, 0 TDs
* Tee Higgins: 4 receptions, 100 yards, 1 TD

# Final statistics

## Statistical comparison

The Rams outgained the Bengals 386-305 in total yards. The Rams also had a 23-18 advantage in first downs and a 35:47-24:13 advantage in time of possession.

## Individual statistics

* Matthew Stafford: 26/40, 283 yards, 3 TDs, 2 INTs
* Joe Burrow: 22/33, 263 yards, 1 TD, 0 INTs
* Cooper Kupp: 8 receptions, 92 yards, 2 TDs
* Tee Higgins: 4 receptions, 100 yards, 1 TD

# Starting lineups

Los Angeles Rams

* Offense: Matthew Stafford (QB), Cam Akers (RB), Cooper Kupp (WR), Odell Beckham Jr. (WR), Van Jefferson (WR), Tyler Higbee (TE), Andrew Whitworth (LT), Austin Corbett (LG), Brian Allen (C), Austin Blythe (RG), Rob Havenstein (RT)
* Defense: Aaron Donald (DT), Greg Gaines (DT), Von Miller (OLB), Leonard Floyd (OLB), Ernest Jones (ILB), Troy Reeder (ILB), Jalen Ramsey (CB), Darious Williams (CB), Taylor Rapp (S), Nick Scott (S)

Cincinnati Bengals

* Defense: B.J. Hill (DT), D.J. Reader (DT), Trey Hendrickson (DE), Sam Hubbard (DE), Logan Wilson (ILB), Germaine Pratt (ILB), Eli Apple (CB), Chidobe Awuzie (CB), Jessie Bates (S), Vonn Bell (S)

# Officials

# Aftermath

The Rams' victory marked their second Super Bowl title in franchise history. The team celebrated their win with a parade in Los Angeles, with thousands of fans in attendance. The Bengals, meanwhile, were left to ponder what could have been, with many players expressing their disappointment and frustration with the loss.

# Notes

* This was the first Super Bowl to be played at SoFi Stadium.
* The Rams' victory marked the first time a team had won the Super Bowl in their home stadium.
* The game was watched by an estimated 112.3 million viewers, making it one of the most-watched television events of the year.

2023 NBA Playoffs

The 2023 NBA playoffs was the postseason tournament of the National Basketball Association's 2022-23 season. The playoffs began on April 15, 2023, and concluded on June 12, 2023. The Denver Nuggets won the NBA championship, defeating the Miami Heat in the NBA Finals, 4-1.

# Overview

The 2023 NBA playoffs saw several teams make their postseason debuts, while others continued their streaks of playoff appearances.

## Updates to postseason appearances

The Chicago Bulls and the Washington Wizards missed the playoffs after making appearances in the previous year's postseason. Meanwhile, the Atlanta Hawks returned to the playoffs after a one-year absence, and the Minnesota Timberwolves made their first playoff appearance since 2018.

## Notable occurrences

The playoffs saw several notable occurrences, including comebacks, upsets, and dominant performances.

### First round

The first round of the playoffs saw several close series, with three series going to a deciding Game 7. The Miami Heat came back from a 3-1 deficit to defeat the Milwaukee Bucks, while the Los Angeles Lakers came back from a 2-1 deficit to defeat the Memphis Grizzlies.

### Conference semifinals

The conference semifinals saw several dominant performances, including a sweep by the Denver Nuggets over the Phoenix Suns. The Boston Celtics also dominated the Philadelphia 76ers, winning the series 4-1.

### Conference finals

The conference finals saw two closely contested series, with the Denver Nuggets defeating the Los Angeles Lakers in five games, and the Miami Heat defeating the Boston Celtics in seven games.

### NBA Finals

The NBA Finals saw the Denver Nuggets face off against the Miami Heat, with the Nuggets winning the series 4-1. The Nuggets' Nikola Jokić was named NBA Finals MVP.

Faithful & District Football Association

The Faithful & District Football Association is a regional Australian rules football competition based in the Faithful region of Victoria, Australia. The association was established in 1909 and has since grown to become one of the largest and most competitive regional football leagues in the state.

# History

The Faithful & District Football Association was formed in 1909, with the aim of providing a structured competition for football clubs in the Faithful region. The association's early years were marked by a series of challenges, including the impact of World War I on player numbers and the difficulties of traveling between clubs in a rural area. Despite these challenges, the association persevered and continued to grow, adding new clubs and expanding its reach throughout the region.

In the 1920s and 1930s, the association began to establish itself as a major force in regional football, with several of its clubs competing in statewide competitions. The association's success during this period was driven by the strength of its clubs, which were able to attract top players from across the region.

In the post-war period, the association continued to grow and expand, with new clubs joining the competition and existing clubs experiencing significant success. The association's grand final, which is played annually between the top two teams in the competition, became a major event in the regional sporting calendar.

In recent years, the association has continued to evolve, with the introduction of new rules and competitions aimed at promoting player safety and development. The association has also invested heavily in infrastructure, including the development of new grounds and facilities for its member clubs.

## Expansion and Restructuring

In the 1990s, the association underwent a significant expansion, with several new clubs joining the competition. This expansion was driven by the association's desire to increase its reach and provide more opportunities for players and clubs in the region.

In 2001, the association underwent a major restructuring, with the introduction of a new divisional system. This system, which featured three divisions, was designed to provide more competitive balance and opportunities for clubs to develop and improve.

## Modern Era

In recent years, the association has continued to thrive, with a strong focus on player development and community engagement. The association has invested heavily in programs aimed at promoting junior football and increasing participation in the sport.

In 2019, the association celebrated its 110th anniversary, marking a major milestone in its history. The association's anniversary celebrations featured a range of events and activities, including a gala dinner and a commemorative match played between past and present players.

The O'Loan Cup is a prestigious award that is presented annually to the best and fairest player in the association. The award is named after Tom O'Loan, a former player and administrator who made a significant contribution to the association.

The O'Loan Cup has been presented since 1921 and has been won by some of the association's greatest players. The award is considered one of the highest honors in the association and is highly coveted by players.

The O'Loan Cup has been won by a total of 56 different players since its inception. The most successful winner of the award is Barry Lyons, who won it four times.

article:
Lists of feature films with LGBT characters

Lists of feature films with LGBT (lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender) characters are collections of films that prominently feature LGBT individuals as main characters, plot points, or themes. These lists aim to provide a comprehensive overview of films that represent the LGBT community, exploring various genres, styles, and eras.

## Early films (1920s-1960s)

The early days of cinema saw a limited representation of LGBT characters, often relegated to minor roles or used as plot devices. However, some films from this era did attempt to tackle LGBT themes, albeit often in a subtle or coded manner.

* **Pandora's Box (1929)**: A German silent film directed by Georg Wilhelm Pabst, featuring a lesbian character played by Louise Brooks.
* **The Children's Hour (1961)**: A drama film directed by William Wyler, exploring the theme of lesbianism in a repressive society.

## New Wave and counterculture (1960s-1970s)

The 1960s and 1970s saw a rise in countercultural and New Wave movements in cinema, which led to increased experimentation and representation of LGBT themes.

* **The Boys in the Band (1970)**: A comedy-drama film directed by William Friedkin, featuring a group of gay men and exploring themes of identity and community.
* **Sunday Bloody Sunday (1971)**: A British drama film directed by John Schlesinger, featuring a gay character played by Peter Finch.
* **The Killing of Sister George (1968)**: A British drama film directed by Robert Aldrich, exploring the theme of lesbianism in a repressive society.

## Mainstream recognition (1980s-1990s)

The 1980s and 1990s saw a growing recognition of LGBT characters in mainstream cinema, with many films earning critical acclaim and commercial success.

* **Desert Hearts (1985)**: A romantic drama film directed by Donna Deitch, featuring a lesbian romance between two women in 1950s Nevada.
* **My Beautiful Laundrette (1985)**: A British comedy-drama film directed by Stephen Frears, featuring a gay character played by Gordon Warnecke.
* **Philadelphia (1993)**: A drama film directed by Jonathan Demme, starring Tom Hanks as a gay man with AIDS.

## Contemporary cinema (2000s-present)

In recent years, there has been a significant increase in LGBT representation in cinema, with many films earning critical acclaim and commercial success.

article:
Elvis (2022 film)

Elvis is a 2022 biographical drama film directed by Baz Luhrmann, who also co-wrote the screenplay with Sam Bromell, Craig Pearce, and Jeremy Doner. The film is based on the life of Elvis Presley, the American musician and actor often referred to as the "King of Rock and Roll." The movie stars Austin Butler as Elvis Presley, alongside Tom Hanks as his manager, Colonel Tom Parker.

#Plot

The film chronicles the life of Elvis Presley, from his humble beginnings in Tupelo, Mississippi, to his rise to fame as a rock and roll icon. The story is told through the eyes of Colonel Tom Parker, Elvis's manager, who narrates the film and provides insight into the singer's life and career. The movie explores Elvis's early days as a young musician, his relationship with his parents, Gladys and Vernon Presley, and his discovery by Colonel Parker.

As Elvis's fame grows, the film delves into his struggles with fame, his relationships with women, including Priscilla Presley, and his addiction to prescription medication. The movie also explores Elvis's impact on popular culture, including his influence on music, fashion, and social change.

#Cast

* Austin Butler as Elvis Presley
* Tom Hanks as Colonel Tom Parker
* Olivia DeJonge as Priscilla Presley
* Maggie Gyllenhaal as Gladys Presley
* Rufus Sewell as Vernon Presley
* Yola as Sister Rosetta Tharpe
* Alton Mason as Little Richard
* Gary Clark Jr. as Arthur "Big Boy" Crudup
* Shonka Dukureh as Willie Mae "Big Mama" Thornton
* Helen Thomson as Gladys Presley (older)
* Richard Roxburgh as Vernon Presley (older)

#Production

##Development and casting

The film was first announced in 2014, with Baz Luhrmann set to direct and Tom Hanks attached to play Colonel Tom Parker. In 2019, Austin Butler was cast as Elvis Presley, following a long and extensive casting process. The film's script was written by Luhrmann, Sam Bromell, Craig Pearce, and Jeremy Doner, with input from Priscilla Presley and other members of the Presley family.

##Filming

Principal photography began in January 2020, in Queensland, Australia, and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in various parts of Australia, including the Gold Coast and Brisbane. The production team built a large set in Queensland to replicate the iconic Sun Studio in Memphis, Tennessee, where Elvis recorded his early hits.

##Music

The film features a wide range of Elvis Presley's music, including some of his most famous hits, such as "Hound Dog," "Jailhouse Rock," and "Suspicious Minds." The movie also features music from other artists, including Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Little Richard, and Arthur "Big Boy" Crudup, who were all influential in Elvis's early career.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was launched in February 2022, with the release of the first trailer. The trailer featured Austin Butler as Elvis Presley, performing some of the singer's most famous hits. The marketing campaign also included a series of promotional posters and social media ads, featuring the film's stars and highlighting the movie's music and fashion.

#Release

##2022 original release

Elvis was released in the United States on June 24, 2022, and in Australia on June 23, 2022. The film received a wide release, playing in over 4,000 theaters across the United States.

##2023 re-release

In January 2023, it was announced that the film would be re-released in theaters, following its success at the Academy Awards. The re-release was scheduled for March 2023, and was expected to play in over 1,000 theaters across the United States.

##Plan for a four-hour cut release

In February 2023, Baz Luhrmann announced that a four-hour cut of the film was being planned for release. The extended cut would feature additional scenes and footage, and would provide a more in-depth look at Elvis's life and career.

#Reception

##Box office

Elvis opened at number two at the US box office, behind the Pixar film Lightyear. The film grossed over $30 million in its opening weekend, and went on to gross over $250 million worldwide.

##Audience viewership

The film received a positive response from audiences, with many praising Austin Butler's performance as Elvis Presley. The film's music and fashion were also widely praised, with many commenting on the film's attention to detail and historical accuracy.

##Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising Austin Butler's performance and the film's music and fashion. However, some critics felt that the film was overly long and that the storytelling was uneven.

##Response of the Presley family

The Presley family, including Priscilla Presley and Lisa Marie Presley, were involved in the production of the film and provided input on the script and the casting. The family has publicly praised the film, with Priscilla Presley calling it "a wonderful tribute to Elvis's life and legacy."

##Accolades

Elvis received several awards and nominations, including eight Academy Award nominations. Austin Butler won the Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama, and the film's costume designer, Catherine Martin, won the Academy Award for Best Costume Design.

#Historical accuracy

The film's historical accuracy has been widely praised, with many commenting on the attention to detail and the film's commitment to accuracy. However, some critics have noted that the film takes some creative liberties with Elvis's life and career.

article:
Etharkkum Thunindhavan

Etharkkum Thunindhavan is a 2022 Indian Tamil-language action thriller film written and directed by Pandiraj. The film stars Suriya, Priyanka Arul Mohan, and Vinay Rai in the lead roles. The movie follows the story of a lawyer who gets entangled in a web of corruption and violence, leading him to take matters into his own hands.

# Plot

The film begins with Kannabiran (Suriya), a successful lawyer who is known for his honesty and integrity. He is approached by a group of women who have been victims of a sex trafficking ring. They request his help in seeking justice, but Kannabiran is hesitant to take up the case. However, after witnessing the cruelty and injustice faced by the victims, he decides to take matters into his own hands.

As Kannabiran delves deeper into the case, he discovers that the sex trafficking ring is run by a powerful and influential politician, Inbasekhar (Vinay Rai). Kannabiran's efforts to expose Inbasekhar and bring him to justice are met with resistance and violence. Despite the challenges, Kannabiran remains determined to fight for the victims and bring an end to the sex trafficking ring.

The film was announced in December 2020, with Suriya and Pandiraj collaborating for the first time. The film's title, Etharkkum Thunindhavan, was revealed in January 2021. The title is inspired by a famous Tamil proverb, which means "You should be afraid of someone who fears no one."

Pre-production work for the film began in February 2021. The film's script was written by Pandiraj, and the story was developed in collaboration with Suriya. The film's music was composed by D. Imman, and the cinematography was handled by R. Rathnavelu.

## Filming

Principal photography for the film began in April 2021 and was completed in September 2021. The film was shot in various locations in Tamil Nadu, including Chennai and Madurai.

## Post-production

# Music

The film's music was composed by D. Imman, and the lyrics were written by Vignesh Shivan and Kabilan. The film's soundtrack features four songs, including "Vaadi Vaasal" and "Sooda Oru Sooriyan." The film's score was well received by critics and audiences alike.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in November 2021, with the release of the film's teaser. The film's trailer was released in December 2021, and it received a positive response from audiences.

## Distribution

The film was distributed by Kamal Haasan's production company, Raaj Kamal Films International. The film was also released in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Australia.

## Home media

The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime Video, and it was released on the platform on April 7, 2022.

# Reception

## Box office

The film was a commercial success, grossing over ₹100 crore at the box office. The film performed well in Tamil Nadu, with collections of over ₹50 crore.

The film received positive reviews from critics, with praise for Suriya's performance and the film's direction. The film's story and screenplay were also praised, with many critics noting that the film was a well-made thriller.

article:
Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is an upcoming American action-adventure film directed by James Mangold and written by Mangold, Jez Butterworth, and John-Henry Butterworth. It is the fifth installment in the Indiana Jones film series and serves as a sequel to Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008).

#Plot

The film takes place in 1969, during the Space Age, and follows an older Indiana Jones as he navigates a complex web of intrigue and adventure. The story centers around the Dial of Destiny, an ancient artifact with the power to manipulate time and space. Jones must confront his past and face new challenges as he embarks on a perilous quest to prevent the Dial from falling into the wrong hands.

As Jones navigates the treacherous landscape of the late 1960s, he is joined by his goddaughter, Helena Shaw, a brilliant and resourceful young woman who becomes his ally in the quest. Together, they must outwit and outrun a cast of nefarious characters, including the enigmatic and ruthless villain, Jürgen Voller.

#Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* Harrison Ford as Indiana Jones
* Phoebe Waller-Bridge as Helena Shaw
* Mads Mikkelsen as Jürgen Voller
* Thomas Kretschmann as Colonel Weber
* Boyd Holbrook as Klaber
* Shaunette Renée Wilson as Mason
* Toby Jones as Basil Shaw
* Antonio Banderas as Renaldo

#Production

##Development

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny was first announced in 2016, with Steven Spielberg set to direct and Harrison Ford reprising his role as Indiana Jones. However, due to creative differences and scheduling conflicts, Spielberg ultimately stepped down as director, and James Mangold was brought on board to helm the project.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2020, with Mangold and his team conducting extensive research and development on the story and characters. The film's script was written by Mangold, Jez Butterworth, and John-Henry Butterworth, with input from Harrison Ford and other members of the cast and crew.

##Casting

The cast was assembled over the course of several months, with Phoebe Waller-Bridge and Mads Mikkelsen joining the project in early 2021. The film's cast is notable for its diversity and inclusivity, with a range of actors from different backgrounds and countries.

##Filming

Principal photography on the film began in June 2021 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in the United Kingdom, Morocco, and Italy, with additional scenes filmed at Pinewood Studios in London.

##Visual effects

The film features a range of visual effects, including CGI, practical effects, and stunts. The visual effects team, led by Michael Gioulakis, worked closely with Mangold and his team to create a unique and immersive visual style for the film.

###De-aging

One of the most notable visual effects in the film is the de-aging of Harrison Ford, who appears in several scenes as a younger Indiana Jones. The de-aging process was achieved using a combination of CGI and practical effects, with Ford's face and body digitally altered to appear younger.

##Music

The film's score was composed by John Williams, who has worked on all five Indiana Jones films. The score features a range of themes and motifs, including the iconic Indiana Jones theme, which has been reworked and reorchestrated for the film.

article:
Cornel Țăranu is a Romanian composer, musicologist, and professor, known for his significant contributions to the development of Romanian music in the 20th century. With a career spanning over six decades, Țăranu has established himself as a prominent figure in the Romanian musical landscape, exploring a wide range of styles and genres.

# Biography

## Early life and neoclassical debut

Cornel Țăranu was born on June 20, 1934, in Cluj-Napoca, Romania. He began his musical studies at the Cluj-Napoca Music Conservatory, where he was exposed to a variety of musical styles and influences. During his early years, Țăranu was particularly drawn to the neoclassical style, which would later become a hallmark of his compositional approach. His early works, such as the Suite for Orchestra (1955) and the String Quartet No. 1 (1956), demonstrate a clear affinity for the neoclassical idiom, characterized by clarity, precision, and a focus on formal structure.

## Paris studies and Ars Nova

In 1960, Țăranu traveled to Paris, where he studied at the École Normale de Musique with renowned composers such as Olivier Messiaen and Pierre Boulez. This period marked a significant turning point in Țăranu's career, as he became increasingly interested in the avant-garde movement and the works of the Ars Nova group. His exposure to the music of Boulez, in particular, had a profound impact on his compositional style, leading to the creation of works such as the Piano Sonata No. 1 (1962) and the String Quartet No. 2 (1963). These pieces showcase Țăranu's growing interest in experimentation and innovation, as well as his ability to blend traditional and modern elements.

## Postmodernism and historicism

During the 1970s and 1980s, Țăranu's compositional style underwent a significant transformation, as he began to explore postmodernist and historicist tendencies. His music from this period, such as the Symphony No. 2 (1975) and the Opera "Carmen" (1981), demonstrates a renewed interest in traditional forms and genres, as well as a willingness to engage with popular culture and historical references. This shift in style was likely influenced by Țăranu's growing concern with the social and cultural context of music, as well as his desire to connect with a broader audience.

## Old age

In recent years, Țăranu has continued to compose music, albeit at a slower pace. His later works, such as the Piano Sonata No. 3 (2001) and the String Quartet No. 4 (2005), demonstrate a greater emphasis on introspection and contemplation, as well as a deepening interest in spirituality and the human condition. Despite his advanced age, Țăranu remains active in the musical community, serving as a professor and mentor to younger composers.

2023 Estonian parliamentary election

The 2023 Estonian parliamentary election was held on 5 March 2023 to elect the 101 members of the Riigikogu, the unicameral parliament of Estonia. The election was the 15th parliamentary election in Estonia since the country's independence from the Soviet Union in 1991.

#Background

The 2023 Estonian parliamentary election was called following the dissolution of the 14th Riigikogu, which had been in office since the 2019 Estonian parliamentary election. The election was held in the context of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine, which had a significant impact on Estonia's economy and foreign policy.

In the run-up to the election, the government of Prime Minister Kaja Kallas, which had been in office since 2021, faced criticism for its handling of the economy and the pandemic. The opposition parties, including the Centre Party and the Conservative People's Party of Estonia (EKRE), called for changes to the government's policies and promised to address the concerns of voters.

#Electoral system

The Estonian electoral system is based on proportional representation, with each voter casting a single ballot for a candidate or party in one of the country's 12 electoral districts. The districts are allocated a total of 101 seats, with the number of seats in each district determined by the population of the district.

##Seats by electoral district

The 12 electoral districts in Estonia are allocated the following number of seats:

* District 1 (Haabersti, Põhja-Tallinn, and Kristiine districts of Tallinn): 9 seats
* District 2 (Kesklinn, Lasnamäe, and Pirita districts of Tallinn): 13 seats
* District 3 (Mustamäe and Nõmme districts of Tallinn): 8 seats

* District 7 (Ida-Viru county): 7 seats

* District 11 (Järva and Viljandi counties): 8 seats
* District 12 (Pärnu county): 7 seats

##Pre-election composition

* Social Democratic Party: 10 seats
* Isamaa: 12 seats
* Estonian Greens: 0 seats

#Campaign

The 2023 Estonian parliamentary election campaign was marked by a focus on issues such as the economy, healthcare, education, and foreign policy.

##Issues

Some of the key issues debated during the campaign included:

* The economy: The government's handling of the economy was a major issue, with opposition parties calling for changes to taxation and spending policies.
* Healthcare: The state of Estonia's healthcare system was a major concern, with parties promising to improve access to healthcare and reduce waiting times.
* Education: The quality of education was a key issue, with parties promising to improve funding for schools and increase teacher salaries.
* Foreign policy: Estonia's relations with Russia and the European Union were a major issue, with parties promising to strengthen the country's defenses and promote its interests abroad.

##Debates

A number of debates were held during the campaign, featuring representatives from each of the contesting parties. The debates were broadcast on television and covered a range of topics, including the economy, healthcare, education, and foreign policy.

#Opinion polls

A number of opinion polls were conducted during the campaign, which suggested that the Reform Party and the Centre Party were the most popular parties.

* District 4 (Harju and Rapla counties): Reform Party 5 seats, Centre Party 3 seats, Conservative People's Party of Estonia (EKRE) 3 seats, Social Democratic Party 2 seats
* District 5 (Hiiu, Lääne, and Saare counties): Centre Party 2 seats, Conservative People's Party of Estonia (EKRE) 2 seats, Social Democratic Party 1 seat, Reform Party 1 seat
* District 6 (Lääne-Viru county): Conservative People's Party of Estonia (EKRE) 2 seats, Centre Party 1 seat, Social Democratic Party 1 seat, Reform Party 1 seat

#Aftermath

Lil Keed
==========

Raqhid Jevon Render, professionally known as Lil Keed, was an American rapper, singer, and songwriter from Atlanta, Georgia. He was signed to Young Thug's record label, YSL Records, and 300 Entertainment. Lil Keed was known for his unique blend of melodic flow and street sensibility, which resonated with fans and critics alike.

Early Life
-----------

Lil Keed was born on March 16, 1998, in Atlanta, Georgia. He grew up in a low-income household with his mother and siblings. Keed's early life was marked by poverty and violence, which would later influence his music. He began rapping at a young age, inspired by artists such as Lil Wayne and T.I.

Career
-------

### 2018: Trapped on Cleveland 2 and Keed Talk To 'Em

Lil Keed's music career began to gain traction in 2018 with the release of his mixtape "Trapped on Cleveland 2". The project featured appearances from Young Thug, Lil Baby, and Gunna, and helped establish Keed as a rising talent in the Atlanta rap scene. Later that year, he released "Keed Talk To 'Em", a mixtape that further showcased his unique style and versatility.

### 2019: Long Live Mexico

In 2019, Lil Keed released his debut studio album "Long Live Mexico", which featured guest appearances from Young Thug, Nav, and Moneybagg Yo. The album received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Keed's melodic flow and introspective lyrics. "Long Live Mexico" was a commercial success, peaking at number 26 on the US Billboard 200 chart.

### 2020: Trapped on Cleveland 3

In 2020, Lil Keed released "Trapped on Cleveland 3", his second studio album. The project featured appearances from Travis Scott, Young Thug, and Chris Brown, and debuted at number 42 on the US Billboard 200 chart. "Trapped on Cleveland 3" received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Keed's growth and maturity as an artist.

### 2023: Keed Talk to 'Em 2

In 2023, Lil Keed released "Keed Talk to 'Em 2", a mixtape that featured appearances from Young Thug, Lil Baby, and Gunna. The project received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Keed's continued growth and innovation as an artist.

Musical Styles
--------------

Lil Keed's music style is a unique blend of melodic flow and street sensibility. He is known for his introspective and often autobiographical lyrics, which frequently touch on themes of poverty, violence, and personal struggle. Keed's music is also characterized by his use of Auto-Tune and other vocal effects, which add to his distinctive sound.

### Influences

Lil Keed has cited a range of influences on his music, including Lil Wayne, T.I., and Young Thug. He has also mentioned being influenced by rock and pop music, and has incorporated elements of these genres into his own sound.

Live Performances
----------------

Lil Keed was known for his high-energy live performances, which often featured him rapping and singing over backing tracks. He performed at a range of venues, from small clubs to large festivals, and was known for his ability to connect with audiences and build a sense of community.

Death
------

Lil Keed died on May 13, 2022, at the age of 24. He was pronounced dead at a hospital in Los Angeles, California, after being rushed there from a hotel room. The cause of death was not immediately disclosed, but it was later reported that Keed had died from a combination of narcotics and fentanyl.

2023 Copa Perú

The 2023 Copa Perú season is the 51st edition of the Copa Perú, the national cup competition of Perú. The competition started on May 1, 2023, and is scheduled to end on November 26, 2023. The winner of the competition will earn a spot in the 2024 Copa Libertadores and the 2024 Copa Sudamericana.

#Departmental stage

The departmental stage is the first stage of the competition, where teams from each of the 24 departments of Perú compete in a series of matches to determine the top teams from each department. The stage started on May 1, 2023, and ended on June 18, 2023. A total of 400 teams participated in this stage, with the top two teams from each department advancing to the national stage.

The departmental stage was played in a round-robin format, with each team playing the other teams from their department twice. The teams earned three points for a win, one point for a draw, and zero points for a loss. The teams with the most points in each department advanced to the national stage.

The national stage is the second stage of the competition, where the top teams from each department compete in a series of matches to determine the top teams in the country. # Gonzalo Lira

Gonzalo Lira is a Chilean-American author, filmmaker, and blogger who gained international recognition for his work on economics, politics, and culture. Born in 1968 in California, USA, to Chilean parents, Lira's unique blend of perspectives has made him a prominent voice in alternative media.

# Early life

Gonzalo Lira was born in 1968 in California, USA, to Chilean parents who had fled their home country after the 1973 military coup that overthrew President Salvador Allende. Lira's early life was marked by a strong connection to his Chilean roots, with his parents instilling in him a deep appreciation for Latin American culture and politics. He spent part of his childhood in Chile, where he developed a strong understanding of the country's complex history and society.

Lira's family eventually returned to the United States, where he completed his education. He developed an interest in economics and politics, which would later become the focus of his writing and filmmaking career. Lira's multicultural background and experiences have had a profound impact on his work, allowing him to offer unique insights into the complexities of global politics and economics.

# Career

Gonzalo Lira began his career as a writer and filmmaker in the early 2000s, producing a range of documentaries and films that explored themes of economics, politics, and culture. His work often focused on the experiences of marginalized communities and the impact of globalization on local societies.

In 2009, Lira launched his blog, "Gonzalo Lira's Blog," where he began to write extensively on economics, politics, and culture. His blog quickly gained a large following, with readers drawn to his insightful analysis and engaging writing style. Lira's blog posts often challenged mainstream narratives on economics and politics, offering alternative perspectives that resonated with readers looking for a more nuanced understanding of global events.

Lira's writing has been widely praised for its clarity, depth, and accessibility. He has been credited with helping to popularize complex economic and political concepts, making them more understandable to a broad audience. His work has been featured in a range of publications, including The Huffington Post, Zero Hedge, and CounterPunch.

# Arrest and prosecution

In 2011, Gonzalo Lira was arrested in Ukraine, where he had been living and working as a journalist. Lira was charged with espionage and treason, allegedly for his reporting on the country's economic and political situation. The charges were widely condemned by human rights groups and media organizations, who saw them as an attempt to silence a critical voice.

Lira was held in prison for several months, during which time he was subjected to physical and psychological abuse. Despite the challenges he faced, Lira continued to write, producing a series of blog posts that detailed his experiences and offered insights into the Ukrainian justice system.

In 2012, Lira was released from prison and allowed to return to Chile, where he continued to write and work as a journalist. The experience had a profound impact on Lira, who wrote extensively about the challenges he faced and the lessons he learned during his time in prison.
