Candidates Tournament 2022

The Candidates Tournament 2022 was an eight-player chess tournament held in Madrid, Spain, from June 16 to July 5, 2022. The tournament was organized by the World Chess Organization (FIDE) and determined the challenger for the World Chess Championship 2022. The tournament featured some of the world's top chess players, including several former World Chess Championship candidates.

# Participants

The Candidates Tournament 2022 featured eight players from around the world, including several former World Chess Championship candidates. The participants were:

* Alireza Firouzja (France)
* Anish Giri (Netherlands)
* Hikaru Nakamura (United States)
* Ian Nepomniachtchi (Russia)
* Ding Liren (China)
* Fabiano Caruana (United States)
* Richard Rapport (Hungary)
* Radjabov, Teimour (Azerbaijan)

## Qualification of Radjabov

Teimour Radjabov qualified for the Candidates Tournament 2022 by winning the FIDE World Cup 2021. Radjabov, who was a former child prodigy and one of the youngest grandmasters in history, had a strong performance in the World Cup, defeating several top players along the way.

## Disqualification of Karjakin

Sergey Karjakin, the 2016 World Chess Championship candidate, was initially qualified for the Candidates Tournament 2022 but was disqualified due to his support for the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Karjakin, who is Russian, had publicly expressed support for the invasion and had also participated in a chess tournament in Moscow that was organized by the Russian government. As a result, FIDE disqualified Karjakin from the Candidates Tournament and replaced him with Richard Rapport.

## Qualification of Ding Liren

Ding Liren qualified for the Candidates Tournament 2022 by winning the FIDE Grand Swiss Tournament 2021. Ding, who is one of the top players in the world, had a strong performance in the tournament, defeating several top players along the way.

The Candidates Tournament 2022 was organized by FIDE and was held in Madrid, Spain, from June 16 to July 5, 2022. The tournament was a double-round robin, with each player playing every other player twice.

The tournament was played according to the standard FIDE rules, with a few modifications. The time control was 100 minutes for the first 40 moves, followed by 50 minutes for the next 20 moves, and then 15 minutes for the rest of the game, with an increment of 30 seconds per move. The tournament was also subject to the FIDE fair play regulations, which prohibit players from using electronic devices or receiving assistance from others during the game.

article:
Black Panther: Wakanda Forever
==========================

Black Panther: Wakanda Forever is a 2022 American superhero film produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. It is the 30th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and a sequel to the 2018 film Black Panther. Directed by Ryan Coogler, who co-wrote the screenplay with Joe Robert Cole, the film follows the nation of Wakanda as they mourn the death of King T'Challa and face a new threat in the form of Namor, the king of the underwater kingdom of Talokan.

Plot
-----

The film takes place after the events of Avengers: Endgame and Spider-Man: No Way Home. King T'Challa has died, and his sister Shuri is struggling to come to terms with his passing. Meanwhile, a new threat emerges in the form of Namor, the king of the underwater kingdom of Talokan. Namor is determined to protect his people and his kingdom from the surface world, and he sees Wakanda as a threat to his plans.

As tensions between Wakanda and Talokan escalate, Shuri, Queen Ramonda, and the rest of the Wakandan people must band together to defend their nation and their way of life. Along the way, they discover a new hero in the form of Riri Williams, a brilliant inventor and engineer who becomes the superhero known as Ironheart.

Cast
-----

* Letitia Wright as Shuri / Black Panther
* Lupita Nyong'o as Nakia
* Danai Gurira as Okoye
* Winston Duke as M'Baku
* Florence Kasumba as Ayo
* Dominique Thorne as Riri Williams / Ironheart
* Michaela Coel as Aneka
* Tenoch Huerta as Namor
* Martin Freeman as Everett K. Ross
* Julia Louis-Dreyfus as Valentina Allegra de Fontaine

Production
------------

### Development

In 2018, Marvel Studios announced plans to develop a sequel to Black Panther, with Ryan Coogler set to return as director and co-writer. However, in August 2020, it was announced that Chadwick Boseman, the star of the first film, had passed away after a private battle with cancer. The sequel was put on hold as the studio and the cast and crew struggled to come to terms with the loss.

In November 2020, it was announced that the sequel would move forward, with Letitia Wright's character Shuri taking on a more central role. The film's title was later revealed to be Black Panther: Wakanda Forever.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in June 2021, with the cast and crew returning to Atlanta, Georgia to begin rehearsals and preparation for filming. The film's script was still being worked on at this time, with Coogler and Cole making changes to the story and characters.

### Filming

Principal photography on the film began on June 29, 2021, and wrapped on November 24, 2021. The film was shot on location in Atlanta, Georgia, as well as in Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic.

### Post-production

Post-production on the film began in November 2021, with the editing team working to assemble the film's final cut. The film's visual effects were also being worked on at this time, with the team creating the film's elaborate action sequences and CGI characters.

Music
-----

The film's score was composed by Ludwig Göransson, who previously worked on the first Black Panther film. The score was recorded with a full orchestra and features a mix of traditional African music and modern electronic elements.

Marketing
---------

The film's marketing campaign began in July 2022, with the release of the film's first teaser trailer. The trailer was met with widespread excitement and anticipation from fans, who were eager to see the next installment in the Black Panther franchise.

Release
-------

### Theatrical

Black Panther: Wakanda Forever was released in theaters on November 11, 2022, in the United States. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, and was also available in Dolby Cinema and ScreenX.

### Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on February 1, 2023, and on Blu-ray and DVD on February 7, 2023.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Black Panther: Wakanda Forever was a commercial success, grossing over $859 million worldwide. The film opened at number one at the box office in the United States, and remained in the top ten for several weeks.

### Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's action sequences, characters, and themes. The film holds a 93% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 422 reviews.

### Accolades

The film received several awards and nominations, including two Academy Award nominations for Best Visual Effects and Best Costume Design.

Documentary special
-------------------

A documentary special titled "The Making of Black Panther: Wakanda Forever" was released on Disney+ in February 2023. The special features behind-the-scenes footage and interviews with the cast and crew.

Future
-------

### Possible sequel

In November 2022, it was announced that a third Black Panther film was in development, with Ryan Coogler set to return as director and co-writer.

### Ironheart

A spin-off series titled Ironheart was announced in April 2021, with Dominique Thorne set to reprise her role as Riri Williams. The series is currently in production and is expected to premiere on Disney+ in 2023.

article:
Effects of Climate Change

Climate change refers to the long-term warming of the planet, which is primarily caused by the increasing levels of greenhouse gases in the Earth's atmosphere. These gases, such as carbon dioxide and methane, trap heat from the sun and prevent it from being released back into space, leading to a rise in the planet's average temperature. The effects of climate change are far-reaching and varied, impacting not only the environment but also human societies and economies.

# Changes in Temperature

One of the most direct and obvious effects of climate change is the increase in global temperatures. The average global temperature has risen by about 1°C since the late 1800s, and the 20 warmest years on record have all occurred since 1981. This warming is not limited to the atmosphere; the oceans, which absorb most of the excess heat, have also warmed, with the top 700 meters of the ocean showing a temperature increase of about 0.7°C since the 1970s.

# Weather

Climate change is also affecting the weather, leading to more extreme and unpredictable events. This is because a warmer atmosphere can hold more moisture, leading to more intense precipitation events, and also because the jet stream, a high-altitude wind current that drives weather patterns, is becoming more unstable.

## Heat Waves and Temperature Extremes

Heat waves, which are periods of abnormally hot weather, are becoming more frequent and prolonged. This is particularly evident in the summer months, when the increased heat can have serious impacts on human health, especially for vulnerable populations such as the elderly and young children. Temperature extremes, such as the record-breaking heat wave that affected Europe in 2019, are also becoming more common.

## Rain

Climate change is also affecting precipitation patterns, leading to more frequent and intense rainfall events. This can cause flooding, landslides, and other hazards, especially in areas with poor drainage or infrastructure. In some regions, the increased rainfall is also leading to more frequent and severe droughts, as the rain falls in intense bursts rather than steady, soaking rains.

## Extreme Storms

Climate change is also linked to an increase in extreme storms, including hurricanes, typhoons, and tornadoes. Warmer ocean temperatures can fuel more intense storms, and rising sea levels can exacerbate storm surges, which are walls of water that can inundate coastal areas.

# Land

Climate change is having significant impacts on the land, including increased flooding, droughts, and wildfires.

## Floods

Flooding is becoming more frequent and severe, especially in areas with poor drainage or infrastructure. This can be due to heavy rainfall, storm surges, or snowmelt, and can have devastating impacts on communities and ecosystems.

## Droughts

Droughts, which are periods of abnormally dry weather, are becoming more frequent and prolonged. This can have serious impacts on agriculture, water supplies, and ecosystems, especially in regions that are already water-scarce.

## Wildfires

Climate change is also contributing to an increase in wildfires, especially in regions with hot and dry summers. Rising temperatures and changing precipitation patterns can create conditions that are ripe for wildfires, which can have devastating impacts on ecosystems and human communities.

# Oceans

Climate change is having significant impacts on the oceans, including sea level rise, ocean acidification, and changes in ocean circulation patterns.

## Sea Level Rise

Sea levels are rising due to the melting of glaciers and ice sheets, as well as the thermal expansion of seawater. This can cause coastal erosion, flooding, and saltwater intrusion into freshwater sources, especially in low-lying areas.

# Ice and Snow

Climate change is also affecting the Earth's ice and snow, including glaciers, ice sheets, sea ice, and permafrost.

## Glaciers Decline

Glaciers, which are slow-moving rivers of ice, are declining rapidly due to climate change. This can have serious impacts on sea levels, as well as on local ecosystems and water supplies.

## Ice Sheets Decline

Ice sheets, which are massive, continent-sized sheets of ice, are also declining due to climate change. This can have significant impacts on sea levels, as well as on global weather patterns.

## Sea Ice Decline

Sea ice, which is the ice that forms on the surface of the oceans, is declining rapidly due to climate change. This can have significant impacts on ocean circulation patterns, as well as on marine ecosystems.

## Permafrost Thawing

Permafrost, which is the frozen soil and rock that underlies much of the Arctic, is thawing due to climate change. This can release methane and other greenhouse gases, which can accelerate climate change.

# Wildlife and Nature

Climate change is having significant impacts on wildlife and nature, including changes in species distribution, behavior, and extinction risk.

## Ecosystems on Land

Climate change is affecting ecosystems on land, including forests, grasslands, and deserts. Rising temperatures and changing precipitation patterns can alter the distribution and abundance of plant and animal species, leading to changes in ecosystem function and resilience.

## Marine Ecosystems

Climate change is also affecting marine ecosystems, including coral reefs, kelp forests, and ocean plankton. Rising ocean temperatures and acidification can alter the distribution and abundance of marine species, leading to changes in ecosystem function and resilience.

# Tipping Points and Irreversible Impacts

Climate change can have tipping points, which are points at which a system undergoes a rapid and irreversible change. These can include the melting of Arctic sea ice, the die-off of coral reefs, and the collapse of ice sheets.

# Health, Food Security and Water Security

Climate change can have significant impacts on human health, food security, and water security.

## Health

Climate change can increase the spread of disease, heat stress, and other health problems, especially for vulnerable populations such as the elderly and young children.

## Food Security

Climate change can affect agriculture, leading to crop failures, reduced yields, and changes in growing seasons. This can have significant impacts on food security, especially in regions that are already food-insecure.

## Water Security

Climate change can affect water supplies, leading to droughts, floods, and changes in water quality. This can have significant impacts on human health, agriculture, and ecosystems.

# Human Settlements

Climate change can have significant impacts on human settlements, including increased flooding, heat stress, and other hazards.

## Impacts from Heat

Climate change can increase the risk of heat stress, especially in urban areas with high population densities and poor air quality.

## Low-Lying Coastal Regions

Climate change can increase the risk of flooding and storm surges in low-lying coastal regions, especially in areas with poor drainage or infrastructure.

# Impacts on Societies

Climate change can have significant impacts on societies, including displacement, migration, conflict, and economic disruption.

## Displacement and Migration

Climate change can lead to displacement and migration, especially in areas with high vulnerability to climate-related hazards.

## Conflict

Climate change can increase the risk of conflict, especially in areas with high competition for resources such as water and land.

## Social Impacts on Vulnerable Groups

Climate change can have significant social impacts on vulnerable groups, including the elderly, young children, and indigenous populations.

## Possibility of Societal Collapse

Climate change can increase the risk of societal collapse, especially in areas with high vulnerability to climate-related hazards and weak governance.

# Economic Impacts

Climate change can have significant economic impacts, including damage to infrastructure, loss of productivity, and changes in economic inequality.

## Economic Inequality

Climate change can increase economic inequality, especially in areas with high vulnerability to climate-related hazards and weak governance.

## Highly Affected Sectors

Climate change can have significant impacts on highly affected sectors, including agriculture, forestry, and tourism.

Bholaa

Bholaa is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Ajay Devgn, who also co-produced the film under his banner Ajay Devgn Films. The film is a remake of the 2019 Tamil film Kaithi, and it marks Devgn's fourth directorial venture.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Bhola, a prisoner who is released from jail after serving a 10-year sentence. Bhola is a simple and honest man who wants to lead a quiet life with his daughter, but his plans are foiled when he is forced to take part in a large-scale operation to rescue a group of police officers who are being held hostage by a group of terrorists.

As Bhola navigates the complex web of events, he discovers that the terrorists are being led by a powerful and ruthless leader who will stop at nothing to achieve his goals. With the help of a few trusted allies, Bhola must use his wits and bravery to outsmart the terrorists and save the hostages.

Throughout the film, Bhola's character is revealed to be a complex and multi-faceted one, driven by a strong sense of justice and a desire to protect those he cares about. As the story unfolds, Bhola's past is slowly revealed, showing how he ended up in jail and how he became the man he is today.

# Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* Ajay Devgn as Bhola
* Tabu as DSP Diana Joseph
* Sanjay Mishra as DSP Vikas
* Deepak Dobriyal as Bagga
* Gajraj Rao as MLA Arjun
* Vineet Kumar as Kalia
* Kiran Kumar as IG Rajan
* Saurabh Shukla as MLA Udaybhan Singh

article:
Dimitrie Stelaru

Dimitrie Stelaru was a Romanian writer, poet, and playwright, known for his contributions to Romanian literature during the mid-20th century. His life and work were marked by periods of creative flourishing, as well as repression and censorship, reflecting the tumultuous social and political climate of his time.

#Biography

##Early life

Dimitrie Stelaru was born on February 18, 1917, in Bucharest, Romania, to a middle-class family. His early life was marked by a strong interest in literature and the arts, encouraged by his parents. Stelaru's father, a lawyer by profession, was an avid reader and collector of books, and the family home was filled with literary and musical activities. Stelaru's mother, a teacher, fostered his early love of poetry and storytelling.

Stelaru began writing at a young age, and his first poems were published in local literary magazines while he was still a high school student. After completing his secondary education, Stelaru enrolled in the University of Bucharest, where he studied literature and philosophy. During his university years, Stelaru became involved in the city's vibrant literary scene, attending poetry readings and salons, and befriending many of the prominent writers of the time.

##Debut and death-hoax

Stelaru's literary debut came in 1937, with the publication of his first collection of poems, "Timpul Pierdut" ("Lost Time"). The book was well-received by critics and established Stelaru as a promising young voice in Romanian literature. However, Stelaru's early success was soon overshadowed by a bizarre incident that would have a lasting impact on his career.

In 1940, a rumor began circulating that Stelaru had died in a tragic accident. The rumor, which was later revealed to be a hoax, was so widespread that it was even reported in several newspapers. The incident caused a significant stir in literary circles, and Stelaru's supposed "death" was even mourned by some of his contemporaries.

The hoax had a profound effect on Stelaru, who was both shocked and amused by the sudden attention. In the aftermath of the incident, Stelaru became increasingly reclusive, and his writing output slowed significantly. However, the experience also had a liberating effect on Stelaru, who began to experiment with new forms and styles in his work.

##Albatros years

In the early 1940s, Stelaru became associated with the Albatros literary circle, a group of young writers who sought to revolutionize Romanian literature through their innovative and experimental works. The Albatros circle was known for its avant-garde style, which blended elements of surrealism, futurism, and dadaism.

During his time with Albatros, Stelaru produced some of his most innovative and critically acclaimed works, including the poetry collection "Cântecul Lebedei" ("The Swan's Song") and the play "Steaua Fără Nume" ("The Nameless Star"). Stelaru's work from this period was characterized by its lyricism, experimentation, and intellectual curiosity.

##Antonescu-era repression and late 1940s

However, Stelaru's association with the Albatros circle also made him a target for the repressive regime of Marshal Ion Antonescu, who ruled Romania from 1940 to 1944. Antonescu's regime was marked by its fascist and anti-Semitic policies, and it viewed the Albatros circle as a threat to its authority.

In 1942, Stelaru was arrested and detained for several months on charges of "subversive activity." The arrest had a devastating effect on Stelaru's mental and physical health, and he was forced to go into hiding to avoid further persecution.

After the war, Stelaru emerged from hiding and attempted to reestablish himself as a writer. However, the late 1940s were a difficult time for Stelaru, who struggled to come to terms with the trauma he had experienced during the war. His writing output slowed significantly, and he became increasingly withdrawn from public life.

##Censoring and obscurity

In the early 1950s, Stelaru's work was subject to censorship by the communist regime that had come to power in Romania. Many of his books were banned or heavily edited, and he was forced to adopt a more cautious and conformist style in his writing.

As a result, Stelaru's work fell into obscurity, and he was largely forgotten by the literary establishment. Stelaru continued to write, but his work was no longer widely read or recognized.

##Final return

In the 1980s, Stelaru began to experience a resurgence in popularity, as a new generation of writers and critics rediscovered his work. Stelaru's final years were marked by a renewed sense of creative energy and purpose, and he continued to write until his death on February 18, 1991.

#Legacy

Dimitrie Stelaru's legacy is complex and multifaceted, reflecting the turbulent and often contradictory nature of his life and work. As a writer, Stelaru was known for his innovative and experimental style, which blended elements of surrealism, futurism, and dadaism.

Stelaru's work also reflects the social and political context in which he lived, including the repression and censorship he experienced during the Antonescu and communist regimes. Despite these challenges, Stelaru continued to write, and his work remains a testament to his creativity, resilience, and intellectual curiosity.

Today, Stelaru is recognized as one of the most important and influential Romanian writers of the 20th century, and his work continues to be read and studied by scholars and literary enthusiasts around the world.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 Beach Volleyball World Championships involved a combination of FIVB Beach Volleyball World Rankings, continental championships, and zonal events. The top teams in the world rankings, as well as the winners of the continental championships, secured direct spots in the tournament. The remaining teams qualified through the zonal events, which were held in different regions of the world.

article:
A Haunting in Venice
=====================

A Haunting in Venice is an upcoming mystery film directed by Kenneth Branagh, based on the 2020 novel Hallowe'en Party by Agatha Christie. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film Death on the Nile and the 2017 film Murder on the Orient Express, also directed by Branagh. The film features an ensemble cast, including Branagh reprising his role as Hercule Poirot, along with Kyle Allen, Camille Cottin, and Tina Fey.

Plot
=====

The film is set in post-World War II Venice, where the famous detective Hercule Poirot is invited to a seance at a local palazzo. However, the evening takes a dark turn when a ghostly presence is felt, and a murder takes place. Poirot is tasked with unraveling the mystery behind the murder, navigating a complex web of secrets, lies, and deceit.

Cast
=====

* Kenneth Branagh as Hercule Poirot
* Kyle Allen as Andrew Kettering
* Camille Cottin as Katharine
* Tina Fey as Ariadne Oliver
* Jamie Dornan as Mark Esson
* Emma Laird as Rowena Drake
* Kelly Reilly as Kate
* Riccardo Scamarcio as Dr. Leoni
* Michelle Yeoh as Joyce Reynolds

Production
==========

### Development

In 2020, it was announced that Kenneth Branagh would direct an adaptation of Agatha Christie's novel Hallowe'en Party, with a script written by Michael Green. The film would be the third installment in the Hercule Poirot film series, following the success of Murder on the Orient Express and Death on the Nile.

### Filming

Principal photography began in November 2022 in Venice, Italy, with the cast and crew filming on location throughout the city. Additional filming took place in London, England, and at Pinewood Studios. The film's production team worked closely with local authorities to minimize the impact of filming on the city's residents and visitors.

### Locations and sets

The film features a range of stunning locations throughout Venice, including the famous Rialto Bridge, St. Mark's Square, and the Grand Canal. The production team also built a number of sets, including the palazzo where the seance takes place, and Poirot's iconic apartment.

### Music

The film's score is composed by Hildur Guðnadóttir, who has previously worked on films such as Joker and Chernobyl. The score features a range of instruments, including piano, cello, and violin, and is designed to evoke the sense of mystery and suspense that is characteristic of Agatha Christie's novels.

Release
======

A Haunting in Venice is scheduled for release in 2023, with a worldwide distribution deal in place with 20th Century Studios. The film's trailer was released in February 2023, giving audiences a glimpse into the mystery and suspense that awaits them.

Reception
=========

### Box office

A Haunting in Venice is expected to perform well at the box office, following the success of the previous two films in the series. The film's release date has been carefully chosen to maximize its potential for success, with a range of marketing and promotional activities planned to support its launch.

### Critical response

While the film has yet to be released, early reviews from critics have been positive, with many praising the film's atmospheric setting, strong performances, and intricate plot. The film's faithfulness to the original novel has also been praised, with many noting that it is a fitting adaptation of Agatha Christie's work.

### Accolades

A Haunting in Venice has been nominated for a number of awards, including several film festival awards and a Golden Globe nomination for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama for Kenneth Branagh.

Future
======

A Haunting in Venice is the third installment in the Hercule Poirot film series, and it is expected that the series will continue with further adaptations of Agatha Christie's novels. The success of the series has been a major factor in the resurgence of interest in Christie's work, and it is likely that the series will continue to be popular with audiences for many years to come.

References
==========

article:
Elizabeth II

Elizabeth II (Elizabeth Alexandra Mary; 21 April 1926 – 8 September 2022) was the monarch of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms from 6 February 1952 until her death in 2022. Her reign of over 70 years was the longest of any British monarch in history.

#Early life

Elizabeth Alexandra Mary was born on 21 April 1926 at 17 Bruton Street in Mayfair, London. She was the first child of Prince Albert, Duke of York (later King George VI), and his wife, Elizabeth, Duchess of York (later Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother). At the time of her birth, Elizabeth was third in the line of succession to the British throne, after her uncle Edward, Prince of Wales, and her father.

Elizabeth spent much of her childhood at 145 Piccadilly, the London home of her parents, and at the Royal Lodge in Windsor Great Park. She was educated at home, with a governess and private tutors, and developed a passion for dogs and horses. In 1936, Elizabeth's grandfather, King George V, died, and her uncle Edward ascended to the throne as King Edward VIII. However, Edward's decision to marry Wallis Simpson, a divorced American woman, caused a constitutional crisis, and he eventually abdicated the throne in December 1936.

#Heir presumptive

Following her uncle's abdication, Elizabeth's father became King George VI, and she became heir presumptive at the age of 10. She was now second in the line of succession to the throne, after her father. Elizabeth's education and training as a future monarch intensified, and she began to take on more public duties.

##Second World War

During the Second World War, Elizabeth and her sister Margaret were evacuated to Balmoral Castle in Scotland and later to Windsor Castle. Elizabeth made her first radio broadcast in 1940, addressing other children who had been evacuated from cities. She began to take on more official duties, including visiting troops and factories, and she was appointed Colonel-in-Chief of the Women's Auxiliary Territorial Service.

##Marriage

In 1947, Elizabeth married Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, a former prince of Greece and Denmark. The couple had four children: Charles, Prince of Wales (born 1948), Anne, Princess Royal (born 1950), Prince Andrew, Duke of York (born 1960), and Prince Edward, Earl of Wessex (born 1964).

#Reign

Elizabeth ascended to the throne on 6 February 1952, following the death of her father. Her coronation took place on 2 June 1953 at Westminster Abbey.

##Accession and coronation

Elizabeth's accession to the throne was marked by a sense of optimism and renewal in the United Kingdom. Her coronation was a grand ceremony, attended by dignitaries from around the world and watched by millions on television.

##Early reign

Elizabeth's early reign was marked by a number of significant events, including the decolonization of Africa and the dissolution of the British Empire. She played an important role in maintaining the unity of the Commonwealth, a voluntary association of former British colonies.

##Political reforms and crises

Elizabeth's reign was marked by a number of significant political reforms, including the decriminalization of homosexuality and the abolition of capital punishment. However, she also faced a number of crises, including the Suez Crisis in 1956 and the Falklands War in 1982.

##Perils and dissent

In the 1970s and 1980s, Elizabeth faced a number of challenges to her authority, including the miners' strike and the Falklands War. She also faced criticism for her handling of the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, in 1997.

##Turbulent years

The 1990s and 2000s were marked by a number of significant events, including the devolution of power to Scotland and Wales and the introduction of the Human Rights Act. Elizabeth also faced criticism for her handling of the financial crisis and her role in the controversy surrounding the News of the World phone-hacking scandal.

##Dawn of the new millennium

In the 2000s, Elizabeth's reign was marked by a number of significant events, including the wedding of Prince William, Duke of Cambridge, and Catherine Middleton in 2011. She also played an important role in promoting British interests abroad, including a state visit to Ireland in 2011.

##Diamond Jubilee and milestones

Elizabeth's Diamond Jubilee was marked by a number of significant events, including a river pageant on the River Thames and a concert at Buckingham Palace. She also marked a number of significant milestones, including the birth of her great-grandson, Prince George of Cambridge, in 2013.

##Pandemic and widowhood

In 2020, Elizabeth faced a number of significant challenges, including the COVID-19 pandemic and the death of her husband, Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, in 2021.

##Platinum Jubilee and beyond

Elizabeth's Platinum Jubilee was marked by a number of significant events, including a pageant and a concert at Buckingham Palace. However, she also faced a number of challenges, including the death of her longtime friend and advisor, the Duke of Kent.

#Death

Elizabeth II died on 8 September 2022 at Balmoral Castle in Scotland. She was succeeded by her son, Charles III.

#Legacy

Elizabeth's legacy is complex and multifaceted. She played an important role in maintaining the unity of the Commonwealth and promoting British interests abroad. However, she also faced criticism for her handling of a number of significant events, including the Suez Crisis and the Falklands War.

##Beliefs, activities, and interests

Elizabeth was a devout Christian and played an important role in promoting the work of the Church of England. She was also a passionate supporter of the arts and was patron of a number of significant cultural institutions.

##Media depiction and public opinion

Elizabeth has been the subject of a number of significant media depictions, including the film "The Queen" and the television series "The Crown." She has also been the subject of a number of public opinion polls, which have generally shown her to be a popular and respected figure.

#Titles, styles, honours, and arms

##Titles and styles

Elizabeth held a number of significant titles and styles, including Queen of the United Kingdom and Head of the Commonwealth.

##Arms

Elizabeth's arms were a significant symbol of her authority and featured a number of significant elements, including the royal crown and the lion and unicorn.

#Issue

Elizabeth had four children:

* Charles, Prince of Wales (born 1948)
* Anne, Princess Royal (born 1950)
* Prince Andrew, Duke of York (born 1960)
* Prince Edward, Earl of Wessex (born 1964)

#Ancestry

Elizabeth's ancestry was complex and multifaceted. She was a descendant of a number of significant royal families, including the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha and the House of Windsor.

article:
Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Mein
==========================

Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Mein is an Indian television drama series that premiered on 5 October 2020 on Star Plus. The show is produced by Cockrow Entertainment and Shaika Films, and it is a remake of the Bengali television series Kusum Dola. The series revolves around the story of a young IPS officer, Virat Chavan, who gets married to a woman, Sai Joshi, to fulfill his mother's last wish.

Plot
-----

The story begins with Virat Chavan, a young IPS officer who is devoted to his mother, Ashwini Chavan. Ashwini, who is suffering from cancer, expresses her last wish to Virat to get married to a girl of her choice. Virat, who is not interested in marriage, reluctantly agrees to fulfill his mother's wish. Ashwini chooses a girl named Sai Joshi, who is a doctor by profession.

Virat and Sai get married, but Virat makes it clear to Sai that he does not love her and that their marriage is only a compromise to fulfill his mother's wish. Sai, who is in love with Virat, tries to win his heart, but Virat remains indifferent towards her.

As the story progresses, Virat's past is revealed, and it is shown that he was in love with a girl named Pakhi, who is now married to his friend, Samrat. Virat's feelings for Pakhi still linger, and he is unable to forget her.

Meanwhile, Sai tries to adjust to her new life as Virat's wife, but she faces opposition from Virat's family members, who do not accept her as one of their own. Sai's efforts to win Virat's heart and gain acceptance from his family members form the crux of the story.

Cast
-----

### Main

* Ayesha Singh as Sai Joshi
* Neil Bhatt as Virat Chavan
* Aishwarya Narkar as Pakhi
* Yogendra Vikram Singh as Samrat
* Kishori Shahane as Ashwini Chavan
* Milind Pathak as Moreshwar Chavan

### Recurring

* Shailesh Datar as Aniket
* Bhakti Chauhan as Karishma
* Sneha Bhawsar as Shweta
* Mridula Oberoi as Shivani
* Rajeev Singh as Vikram

### Guest appearances

* Manish Khanna as Professor
* Nalini Negi as Priya

Production
------------

### Controversy

The show has been involved in several controversies since its inception. The show's lead actress, Ayesha Singh, was criticized for her portrayal of the character Sai Joshi, with some viewers feeling that she was not suitable for the role. The show's storyline has also been criticized for being regressive and promoting patriarchal values.

### Casting

The casting process for the show was rigorous, with the makers auditioning several actors for the lead roles. Ayesha Singh was ultimately chosen to play the role of Sai Joshi, while Neil Bhatt was chosen to play the role of Virat Chavan.

### Development

The show's concept was developed by the makers of Cockrow Entertainment and Shaika Films, who wanted to create a show that would appeal to a wide range of audiences. The show's storyline was inspired by the Bengali television series Kusum Dola.

### Filming

The show is filmed in Mumbai, with the makers using a combination of indoor and outdoor locations to bring the story to life. The show's cinematography is handled by a team of experienced professionals, who use advanced technology to capture high-quality footage.

### Release

The show premiered on 5 October 2020 on Star Plus, with the makers promoting the show through a series of teasers and promos. The show's premiere episode was well-received by viewers, with the show quickly gaining a loyal fan base.

Crossovers
------------

The show has had several crossovers with other Star Plus shows, including Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai and Yeh Hai Chahatein. These crossovers have been well-received by viewers, who enjoy seeing their favorite characters from different shows come together.

Television special
-------------------

### Ravivaar With Star Parivaar (2022)

The show was part of the television special Ravivaar With Star Parivaar, which brought together several Star Plus shows for a special episode. The episode was well-received by viewers, who enjoyed seeing their favorite characters from different shows come together.

Soundtrack
------------

The show's soundtrack is composed by a team of experienced musicians, who use a combination of traditional and modern instruments to create the show's theme music and background score. The show's title track is sung by a well-known playback singer, and has become popular among viewers.

article:
2022 Winter Olympics opening ceremony

The opening ceremony of the 2022 Winter Olympics, officially known as the XXIV Olympic Winter Games, took place on Friday, February 4, 2022, at the Beijing National Stadium in Beijing, China. The ceremony marked the beginning of the Winter Olympics, which ran from February 4 to 20, 2022. The event was attended by a global audience, including dignitaries, athletes, and officials from around the world.

# Ceremony key team

The opening ceremony was directed by Zhang Yimou, a renowned Chinese film director, who had previously directed the opening ceremony of the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing. The creative team included Wang Chaoge and Meng Jinghui as co-directors, and Shen Di as the chief choreographer. The ceremony's theme and concept were developed by a team of artists, designers, and musicians from China and around the world.

# Theme and concept

The theme of the opening ceremony was "One World, One Family," emphasizing the unity and solidarity of nations and people from around the world. The concept was inspired by traditional Chinese culture and the natural beauty of the winter season. The ceremony aimed to showcase the cultural heritage of China, while also highlighting the values of Olympism, such as friendship, respect, and fair play.

# Preparations

Preparations for the opening ceremony began several years in advance, with a team of thousands of people working on the event. The Beijing National Stadium, also known as the Bird's Nest, was renovated and transformed to accommodate the ceremony. A large LED screen was installed on the floor of the stadium, and a complex system of lights, sound, and special effects was put in place. The ceremony's program was kept secret until the day of the event, but rehearsals took place in the weeks and months leading up to the ceremony.

# Proceedings

The opening ceremony was a highly choreographed and orchestrated event, featuring a range of performances, rituals, and traditions.

## Rites of spring: Countdown performance

The ceremony began with a countdown performance, titled "Rites of Spring," which featured a group of performers dressed in traditional Chinese clothing, dancing and playing musical instruments. The performance was accompanied by a dramatic lighting and sound display, and marked the beginning of the ceremony.

## Entry of the National flag

The national flag of China was carried into the stadium by a group of athletes, accompanied by the Chinese national anthem. The flag was raised to the top of the flagpole, and the audience was asked to stand in respect.

## Olympic Rings Reveal

The Olympic rings were revealed in a dramatic display of lights and fireworks, accompanied by music and dance performances. The rings were formed by a group of performers holding LED lights, which were synchronized to create the iconic Olympic symbol.

## Parade of nations

The parade of nations was a highlight of the ceremony, featuring athletes from all participating countries, dressed in their national uniforms and carrying their national flags. The athletes marched into the stadium in alphabetical order, accompanied by music and cheering from the audience.

## Opening of the Olympic Games

The International Olympic Committee (IOC) President, Thomas Bach, declared the 2022 Winter Olympics officially open, marking the beginning of the Games.

## Tribute to the People

A tribute was paid to the people of China, who had worked tirelessly to make the Games a success. The tribute featured a performance by a group of Chinese artists, highlighting the country's rich cultural heritage.

## Olympic Flag Entry and Raising

The Olympic flag was carried into the stadium by a group of athletes, accompanied by the Olympic anthem. The flag was raised to the top of the flagpole, and the audience was asked to stand in respect.

## Oath taking

The Olympic oath was taken by an athlete, a judge, and a coach, representing the three main stakeholders of the Olympic Games. The oath was sworn on the Olympic flag, and marked a commitment to fair play and respect for the rules of the Games.

## Snowflakes performance

A performance titled "Snowflakes" featured a group of dancers, dressed in white costumes, performing a choreographed routine to music and snow effects. The performance was a celebration of the beauty and wonder of snow.

## Arrival and lighting of the Olympic flame

The Olympic flame was lit by a group of athletes, using a torch that had been carried from Olympia, Greece, to Beijing. The flame was lit in a dramatic display of fireworks and music, marking the official start of the Games.

# Anthems

The national anthems of China and the Olympic anthem were performed during the ceremony, accompanied by the national flags and Olympic rings.

# Dignitaries in attendance

## Host nation

The ceremony was attended by a number of dignitaries from the host nation, China, including the President of China, Xi Jinping, and the Premier of China, Li Keqiang.

## International

The ceremony was also attended by a number of international dignitaries, including the IOC President, Thomas Bach, and representatives from the participating countries.

# Controversy and concerns

## Taiwan's participation

Taiwan's participation in the Games was a source of controversy, due to the island's sensitive political status. Taiwan competed under the name "Chinese Taipei," and its athletes were not allowed to display the Taiwanese flag or anthem.

## Ratings on NBC network

The ceremony's ratings on the NBC network in the United States were lower than expected, due to a number of factors, including the time difference between Beijing and the US, and the lack of US athletes in the ceremony.

## Hanbok controversy

A controversy arose over the wearing of traditional Korean clothing, known as hanbok, by a Chinese performer during the ceremony. The incident sparked a heated debate over cultural appropriation and the ownership of traditional cultural symbols.

article:
Agnipath Scheme

The Agnipath Scheme is a recruitment initiative by the Indian government to enroll soldiers into the Indian Armed Forces for a period of four years, with the option to retain a percentage of them in regular military service. The scheme aims to modernize the military and provide opportunities for young individuals to serve the country. The introduction of the scheme has sparked controversy and debate, with various stakeholders expressing concerns about its implications.

#Background

The Indian Armed Forces have been facing challenges in recent years, including an aging population and a significant shortage of young personnel. The forces have also been struggling to adapt to modern warfare and technological advancements. In response to these challenges, the government has been exploring new recruitment models and strategies to modernize the military.

In 2022, the Indian government announced the Agnipath Scheme, a radical departure from the traditional recruitment model. The scheme aims to enroll soldiers for a period of four years, with the option to retain a percentage of them in regular military service. The government claims that the scheme will provide opportunities for young individuals to serve the country and modernize the military.

#Overview

The Agnipath Scheme is designed to enroll soldiers into the Indian Armed Forces for a period of four years. During this period, the soldiers will undergo training and serve in various military roles. At the end of the four-year period, a percentage of the soldiers will be retained in regular military service, while the rest will be released from service.

The scheme is open to individuals between the ages of 17.5 and 23 years, with a maximum age limit of 25 years for certain categories. The recruitment process involves a written examination, physical fitness test, and medical examination. The selected candidates will undergo training at various military institutions and will be deployed in various military roles.

#Reservation and welfare benefits

The Agnipath Scheme provides reservation and welfare benefits to the soldiers enrolled under the scheme. The government has announced that 10% of the vacancies in the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) and the Assam Rifles will be reserved for Agniveers. Additionally, the government has announced that Agniveers will be entitled to a range of welfare benefits, including medical insurance, disability benefits, and education assistance.

However, critics have argued that the reservation and welfare benefits offered under the scheme are inadequate and do not provide sufficient support to the soldiers. They have also argued that the scheme does not provide adequate job security or career progression opportunities.

#Criticism

The Agnipath Scheme has faced widespread criticism from various stakeholders, including political parties, activists, and retired defence personnel.

##By political parties and activists

Political parties and activists have criticized the scheme for its perceived flaws and inadequacies. They have argued that the scheme does not provide adequate job security or career progression opportunities and that the reservation and welfare benefits offered under the scheme are inadequate.

The opposition parties have also criticized the government for introducing the scheme without proper consultation and discussion. They have argued that the scheme will lead to the creation of a "hollow" military, with inadequate numbers of experienced personnel.

##By retired defence personnel

Retired defence personnel have also criticized the scheme, arguing that it will lead to the devaluation of military service and the erosion of the military's institutional culture. They have argued that the scheme will create a " mercenaries' army" and that it will undermine the morale and discipline of the armed forces.

##By state governments

State governments have also criticized the scheme, arguing that it will lead to the displacement of state police forces and the erosion of state authority. They have argued that the scheme will create a parallel security structure and that it will undermine the state's ability to maintain law and order.

##Data on employment of veterans

Data on the employment of veterans has also raised concerns about the scheme. According to official data, only 3.4% of retired defence personnel are employed in the private sector. This has raised concerns about the ability of Agniveers to find employment after their release from service.

#Protests

The Agnipath Scheme has sparked widespread protests across the country, with various stakeholders expressing their opposition to the scheme.

##Bharat Bandh (All India Strike)

On June 20, 2022, a Bharat Bandh (All India Strike) was called by opposition parties and activists to protest against the scheme. The strike was observed in various parts of the country, with protesters blocking roads and railways and clashing with police.

##21 June onwards

Protests continued across the country on June 21 and subsequent days, with protesters demanding the withdrawal of the scheme. The protests were marked by violence and clashes between protesters and police, resulting in the death of several protesters and the injury of many others.

#Response by the Government

The government has responded to the protests by announcing a range of concessions and incentives to Agniveers. The government has announced that Agniveers will be entitled to a range of benefits, including medical insurance, disability benefits, and education assistance.

The government has also announced that it will provide employment opportunities to Agniveers in the private sector and that it will work with state governments to provide employment opportunities in the public sector.

#Plea in the Supreme Court against the scheme

A plea has been filed in the Supreme Court against the Agnipath Scheme, challenging its constitutionality and legality. The plea argues that the scheme is arbitrary and discriminatory and that it violates the fundamental rights of citizens.

#First Agniveer batch (2023)

The first batch of Agniveers was enrolled in 2023, with over 46,000 candidates selected for the scheme. The Agniveers underwent training at various military institutions and were deployed in various military roles.

##Hyderabad

The first batch of Agniveers was inducted into the Indian Air Force at the Air Force Academy in Hyderabad. The Agniveers underwent training in various military roles, including flying, technical, and non-technical roles.

##Nashik

The first batch of Agniveers was also inducted into the Indian Army at the Infantry School in Nashik. The Agniveers underwent training in various military roles, including infantry, artillery, and engineer roles.

##Ranikhet

The first batch of Agniveers was also inducted into the Indian Navy at the Naval Academy in Ranikhet. The Agniveers underwent training in various military roles, including sailing, technical, and non-technical roles.

#Amendment in recruitment procedure

The government has announced an amendment in the recruitment procedure for Agniveers, allowing candidates to apply online and undergo a centralized recruitment process. The amendment aims to simplify the recruitment process and reduce the time taken for recruitment.

Killing of Nahel Merzouk

The killing of Nahel Merzouk was a high-profile incident that occurred on June 27, 2023, in Nanterre, a suburb of Paris, France. The incident sparked widespread outrage and protests, particularly among the immigrant community, and raised concerns about police brutality and racial profiling.

# Background

In recent years, France has been grappling with issues of immigration, policing, and social unrest. The country has a long history of tensions between law enforcement and immigrant communities, particularly in urban areas. The killing of Nahel Merzouk was the latest in a series of incidents that highlighted these tensions and sparked renewed calls for reform.

# Victim

Nahel Merzouk was a 17-year-old French-Algerian high school student who lived in Nanterre. He was described by friends and family as a bright and ambitious young man who was passionate about sports and music. Merzouk was also an active member of his community, participating in local volunteer work and advocating for social justice.

# Shooting

## Prosecution version

According to the prosecution, Nahel Merzouk was shot and killed by a police officer during a traffic stop. The officer claimed that Merzouk had attempted to flee the scene and had threatened him with a knife. The prosecution alleged that the officer had acted in self-defense, fearing for his life.

## Police version challenged by a video

However, a video of the incident, captured by a bystander, appeared to contradict the police version of events. The video showed Merzouk being shot while attempting to flee, but it did not show him brandishing a knife. The video sparked widespread outrage and calls for the officer to be charged with manslaughter.

## Version from the third passenger

A third passenger, who was in the car with Merzouk, gave a different account of the incident. According to the passenger, the police officer had been aggressive and had used excessive force. The passenger claimed that Merzouk had not threatened the officer and had been attempting to surrender when he was shot.

# Investigation

The incident was investigated by the French police internal affairs unit, the Inspection générale de la police nationale (IGPN). The investigation was widely criticized for being slow and opaque, with many calling for greater transparency and accountability.

# Initial reactions

The killing of Nahel Merzouk sparked widespread outrage and protests across France. Many took to the streets to demand justice and call for an end to police brutality. The incident also sparked a heated debate about immigration and policing, with many arguing that the incident was symptomatic of a broader problem of systemic racism.

## Polemics on immigration

The incident sparked a polarized debate about immigration, with some calling for greater controls and others arguing that the incident was a result of systemic racism. The debate was fueled by comments from far-right politicians, who called for greater security measures and stricter immigration controls.

# Unrest

The killing of Nahel Merzouk sparked widespread unrest, with protests and riots erupting in cities across France. The unrest was particularly intense in urban areas, where immigrant communities have long felt marginalized and excluded. The incident highlighted the deep-seated tensions between law enforcement and immigrant communities, and raised concerns about social cohesion and national unity.

article:
Fenwick Tree
================

A Fenwick tree, also known as a binary indexed tree, is a data structure used to efficiently calculate prefix sums and update elements in an array. It is particularly useful in situations where the array is too large to be stored in memory or when the elements are changing frequently. The Fenwick tree was first proposed by Peter Fenwick in 1994 as a solution to the problem of calculating prefix sums in an array.

Motivation
------------

The motivation behind the development of the Fenwick tree was to find an efficient way to calculate prefix sums in an array. A prefix sum is the sum of all elements up to a given index in the array. This is a common problem in many areas of computer science, such as algorithms, data analysis, and machine learning. The naive approach to calculating prefix sums is to iterate through the array and add up all the elements up to the given index, which has a time complexity of O(n). However, this approach becomes impractical for large arrays or when the elements are changing frequently. The Fenwick tree provides a more efficient solution to this problem by allowing for the calculation of prefix sums in O(log n) time.

Description
------------

The Fenwick tree is a data structure that consists of an array of size n, where n is the number of elements in the array. Each element in the Fenwick tree represents the cumulative sum of the elements in the array up to a certain index.

### The Interrogation Tree

The interrogation tree is a representation of the Fenwick tree that shows how the elements are related to each other. The interrogation tree is a binary tree where each node represents an element in the Fenwick tree. The parent node of a given node represents the cumulative sum of the elements up to the index of the child node. The interrogation tree is used to visualize the relationships between the elements in the Fenwick tree and to understand how the prefix sums are calculated.

### The Update Tree

The update tree is a representation of the Fenwick tree that shows how the elements are updated. The update tree is a binary tree where each node represents an element in the Fenwick tree. When an element is updated, the update tree is traversed from the root node to the leaf node that represents the updated element. The cumulative sums are updated at each node along the way. The update tree is used to visualize the process of updating the elements in the Fenwick tree.

### The Search Tree

The search tree is a representation of the Fenwick tree that shows how the prefix sums are calculated. The search tree is a binary tree where each node represents an element in the Fenwick tree. When a prefix sum is calculated, the search tree is traversed from the root node to the leaf node that represents the index of the prefix sum. The cumulative sums are calculated at each node along the way. The search tree is used to visualize the process of calculating prefix sums in the Fenwick tree.

Pseudocode
------------

The following pseudocode shows how to construct a Fenwick tree and how to calculate prefix sums and update elements.

### Construction

```
function FenwickTree(arr):
  n = length(arr)
  tree = new array(n + 1)
  for i from 1 to n:
    tree[i] = arr[i - 1]
    j = i + (i & -i)
    if j <= n:
      tree[j] += tree[i]
  return tree
```

This pseudocode constructs a Fenwick tree from a given array. The `FenwickTree` function takes an array `arr` as input and returns a Fenwick tree. The `tree` array is initialized with the same length as the input array plus one. The elements of the `tree` array are updated using the following formula: `tree[i] = arr[i - 1] + tree[i - (i & -i)]`. This formula calculates the cumulative sum of the elements up to the index `i`.

See Also
------------

* Binary Indexed Tree
* Prefix Sum
* Cumulative Sum

References
------------

* Fenwick, P. (1994). "A new data structure for cumulative frequency tables". Software: Practice and Experience, 24(3), 327-336.

External Links
---------------

* GeeksforGeeks: Fenwick Tree (Binary Indexed Tree)
* LeetCode: Fenwick Tree

article:
Everything Everywhere All at Once
=====================================

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a 2022 American absurdist science fiction comedy-drama film written and directed by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, collectively known as the Daniels. The film stars Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan, Jenny Slate, Harry Shum Jr., and Jamie Lee Curtis. It follows the story of Evelyn Wang, a middle-aged Chinese-American woman who discovers that she can access parallel universes and must use this ability to prevent a powerful being from destroying the multiverse.

Plot
-----

The film begins with Evelyn Wang (Michelle Yeoh), a middle-aged Chinese-American woman who runs a laundromat with her husband, Waymond (Ke Huy Quan). The couple is being audited by the IRS, and Evelyn is struggling to balance her business and personal life. During the audit, Evelyn is suddenly thrust into a parallel universe where she is a successful businesswoman and martial artist.

As Evelyn navigates this new universe, she discovers that she can access multiple parallel universes and must use this ability to prevent a powerful being known as "Jobu Tupaki" from destroying the multiverse. Jobu Tupaki is a being from a universe where everything is possible, and she seeks to destroy all other universes to prove her own existence.

Evelyn's journey takes her through various parallel universes, each with its own unique version of her life. She encounters alternate versions of herself, including a universe where she is a successful actress, a universe where she is a skilled martial artist, and a universe where she is a loving mother.

Throughout the film, Evelyn must confront her own regrets and disappointments, and she must learn to accept herself and her choices. The film's climax features a showdown between Evelyn and Jobu Tupaki, with the fate of the multiverse hanging in the balance.

Cast
-----

* Michelle Yeoh as Evelyn Wang
* Ke Huy Quan as Waymond Wang
* Jenny Slate as Big Nose
* Harry Shum Jr. as Chad
* Jamie Lee Curtis as Deirdre Beaubeirdre

Production
------------

### Development

The Daniels began working on the script for Everything Everywhere All at Once in 2016. The film was inspired by the Daniels' own experiences with existentialism and the concept of parallel universes. The script was developed in collaboration with Michelle Yeoh, who was attached to the project from the early stages.

The film was produced by Jonathan Wang and the Russo brothers, who are known for their work on the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The film's budget was $25 million, which allowed the Daniels to create a visually stunning and ambitious film.

### Casting

Michelle Yeoh was the first actor to be cast in the film. She was attracted to the project because of the complexity and depth of the character of Evelyn Wang. Ke Huy Quan was cast as Waymond Wang, Evelyn's husband, after a long auditioning process.

The supporting cast includes Jenny Slate, Harry Shum Jr., and Jamie Lee Curtis. The film features a diverse cast, which reflects the Daniels' commitment to representation and inclusivity.

### Filming

Principal photography began in January 2020 and lasted for 38 days. The film was shot on location in Los Angeles and San Francisco, with additional scenes filmed in Singapore and Malaysia.

The film's cinematography was handled by Larkin Seiple, who used a combination of digital and film cameras to create a unique visual style. The film's editing was handled by Paul Rogers, who worked closely with the Daniels to create a fast-paced and dynamic editing style.

### Visual effects

The film's visual effects were handled by a team of artists and technicians from around the world. The film features a range of visual effects, including CGI, animation, and practical effects.

The film's visual effects were used to create the various parallel universes, each with its own unique visual style. The film's climax features a showdown between Evelyn and Jobu Tupaki, which was created using a combination of visual effects and practical effects.

Themes
------

Everything Everywhere All at Once explores a range of themes, including existentialism, identity, and the concept of parallel universes. The film is a commentary on the human condition, and it explores the complexities and challenges of life.

The film also explores the concept of identity and how it is shaped by our choices and experiences. The film's protagonist, Evelyn Wang, is a complex and multifaceted character who is struggling to find her place in the world.

The film's use of parallel universes allows the Daniels to explore different versions of Evelyn's life, each with its own unique characteristics and challenges. The film's climax features a showdown between Evelyn and Jobu Tupaki, which is a commentary on the nature of existence and the concept of identity.

Music
------

The film's score was composed by Son Lux, a band known for their experimental and avant-garde music. The score features a range of instruments, including piano, guitar, and electronics.

The film's soundtrack also features a range of songs, including "This Is Life" by Sufjan Stevens and "Everything Everywhere All at Once" by Son Lux. The soundtrack was released in March 2022, and it features a range of music that reflects the film's themes and tone.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Everything Everywhere All at Once was released in theaters on March 11, 2022. The film was released in a limited capacity, with a wider release planned for later in the month.

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics praising its originality, creativity, and performances. The film was also a commercial success, grossing over $100 million at the box office.

### Home media

The film was released on home media on June 7, 2022. The film is available on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms, including Amazon Prime Video and Apple TV.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Everything Everywhere All at Once was a commercial success, grossing over $100 million at the box office. The film's success was due in part to its positive word-of-mouth and critical acclaim.

The film's box office performance was also affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the film industry. Despite these challenges, the film was able to perform well at the box office and establish itself as a cult classic.

### Critical response

Everything Everywhere All at Once received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics praising its originality, creativity, and performances. The film holds a 95% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 8.4/10.

The film's critical success was due in part to its unique blend of genres, including science fiction, comedy, and drama. The film's performances, particularly Michelle Yeoh's performance as Evelyn Wang, were also widely praised.

### Legacy

Everything Everywhere All at Once has established itself as a cult classic, with a dedicated fan base and widespread critical acclaim. The film's success has also paved the way for more experimental and avant-garde films, which are pushing the boundaries of the medium.

The film's influence can be seen in a range of other films and TV shows, including the Marvel Cinematic Universe and the animated series "Rick and Morty". The film's use of parallel universes and multiverse theory has also inspired a range of other creative works, including video games and novels.

# Format

2022 NBA Playoffs

The 2022 NBA playoffs was the postseason tournament of the National Basketball Association's 2021-22 season. The playoffs began on April 16, 2022 and ended on June 16, 2022. The Golden State Warriors were crowned the NBA champions, defeating the Boston Celtics in the NBA Finals, 4-2.

# Overview

The 2022 NBA playoffs saw several notable updates to postseason appearances and occurrences. The Brooklyn Nets, led by Kevin Durant and Kyrie Irving, made their fourth consecutive playoff appearance, while the Chicago Bulls returned to the playoffs for the first time since 2017. The Phoenix Suns, led by Devin Booker and Chris Paul, earned the number one seed in the Western Conference, while the Miami Heat secured the number one seed in the Eastern Conference.

## Notable updates to postseason appearances

* The Brooklyn Nets made their fourth consecutive playoff appearance.
* The Chicago Bulls returned to the playoffs for the first time since 2017.
* The Phoenix Suns earned the number one seed in the Western Conference.
* The Miami Heat secured the number one seed in the Eastern Conference.

## Notable occurrences

* The Golden State Warriors won their seventh NBA championship, their first since 2018.
* The Boston Celtics made their first NBA Finals appearance since 2010.
* The Memphis Grizzlies won their first playoff series since 2014.

# Format

The 2022 NBA playoffs followed the standard 16-team playoff format, with eight teams from each conference qualifying for the postseason. The playoffs consisted of four rounds: the first round, conference semifinals, conference finals, and the NBA Finals.

University of Miami

The University of Miami is a private research university located in Coral Gables, Florida, United States. Founded in 1925, the university has a long history of academic excellence and has grown to become one of the largest private universities in the southeastern United States. With a diverse range of academic programs, research opportunities, and extracurricular activities, the University of Miami offers students a unique and enriching educational experience.

#History

The University of Miami was founded in 1925 by a group of local business leaders, led by George E. Merrick, who was the founder of Coral Gables. The university's early years were marked by significant growth and development, with the establishment of several new schools and colleges, including the College of Arts and Sciences, the School of Law, and the School of Business Administration. During World War II, the university played an important role in the war effort, with the campus being used as a military training facility.

##Leadership

The University of Miami has had several notable leaders throughout its history.

###Bowman Foster Ashe (1926 to 1952)

Bowman Foster Ashe was the university's first president, serving from 1926 to 1952. During his tenure, Ashe oversaw significant growth and development at the university, including the establishment of several new schools and colleges.

###Jay F. W. Pearson (1952 until 1962)

Jay F. W. Pearson served as president from 1952 until 1962. During his tenure, Pearson oversaw the expansion of the university's academic programs and the establishment of new research centers.

###Henry King Stanford (1962 until 1981)

Henry King Stanford served as president from 1962 until 1981. During his tenure, Stanford oversaw significant growth and development at the university, including the establishment of several new schools and colleges.

###Edward T. Foote II (1981 until 2000)

Edward T. Foote II served as president from 1981 until 2000. During his tenure, Foote oversaw significant growth and development at the university, including the establishment of several new research centers and the expansion of the university's academic programs.

###Donna Shalala (2000 until 2015)

Donna Shalala served as president from 2000 until 2015. During her tenure, Shalala oversaw significant growth and development at the university, including the establishment of several new schools and colleges.

###Julio Frenk (2015 until 2024)

Julio Frenk served as president from 2015 until 2024. During his tenure, Frenk oversaw significant growth and development at the university, including the establishment of several new research centers and the expansion of the university's academic programs.

#Campus

The University of Miami has several campuses, including the Coral Gables campus, the Medical school campus, the Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science campus, and the South and Richmond campuses.

##Coral Gables campus

The Coral Gables campus is the university's main campus and is located in Coral Gables, Florida. The campus is home to several academic buildings, including the College of Arts and Sciences, the School of Business Administration, and the School of Law.

###Student housing

The university offers several student housing options, including dormitories and apartments. The university's student housing is designed to provide students with a comfortable and supportive living environment.

##Medical school campus

The Medical school campus is located in Miami, Florida, and is home to the university's Miller School of Medicine. The campus includes several academic buildings, including the medical school building and the university's hospital.

##Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science campus

The Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science campus is located on Virginia Key, Florida, and is home to the university's Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science. The campus includes several academic buildings, including the Rosenstiel School building and the university's marine laboratory.

##South and Richmond campuses

The South and Richmond campuses are located in Miami, Florida, and are home to several of the university's academic programs, including the School of Architecture and the School of Engineering.

##Libraries

The university has several libraries, including the Otto G. Richter Library, the Paul Buisson Reference Library, and the Marta and Austin Weeks Music Library. The university's libraries provide students with access to a wide range of academic resources, including books, journals, and online databases.

#Academics

The University of Miami offers a wide range of academic programs, including undergraduate and graduate degree programs. The university's academic programs are designed to provide students with a comprehensive education in their chosen field.

##Accreditations

The university is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges. The university's academic programs are also accredited by several professional accrediting agencies, including the American Bar Association and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

##Undergraduate admissions

The university's undergraduate admissions process is highly competitive. The university requires applicants to submit a range of materials, including transcripts, test scores, and letters of recommendation.

##Organization

The university is organized into several schools and colleges, including the College of Arts and Sciences, the School of Business Administration, and the School of Law. Each school and college offers a range of academic programs, including undergraduate and graduate degree programs.

##Attendance costs

The university's attendance costs vary depending on the student's program and residency status. The university offers several financial aid options, including scholarships and loans.

##Rankings

The university is ranked highly by several national and international rankings, including U.S. News & World Report and Times Higher Education.

##Research

The university is a major research institution, with several research centers and institutes. The university's research programs are designed to provide students with hands-on research experience and to advance knowledge in their chosen field.

#Student life

The university offers a wide range of student life activities, including clubs and organizations, recreational sports, and cultural events.

#Athletics

The university's athletic teams, known as the Miami Hurricanes, compete in the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Division I.

##Football
